Therefore I hold Trainings on Kubernetes and write articles on my Blog about Cloud Native Technologies.

name: Christian Zambrano
bio: I am a Multicloud(AWS/GCP) Certified Software Architect with 20 years of experience designing, creating and supporting Highly Available event-driven applications. I have a passion for helping teams realize all the benefits Cloud Native technology provides. I currently run bi-weekly employer-internal Cloud Meetups to help make connections, educate and stay up to date on the constantly evolving Cloud Native landscape.

name: Christina Andonov
bio: I am a Solutions Architect at AWS where I help organization adopt Kubernetes at scale. The two areas I focus on are Platform Engineering and Data on Kubernetes.

name: Christoph Blecker
bio: Christoph is an Architect and Senior Principal Site Reliability Engineer at Red Hat and a maintainer of the Kubernetes project. He has served two terms on the Kubernetes Steering Committee, is a Technical Lead for SIG Contributor Experience, and a co-chair for the CNCF Code of Conduct working group. If he's not reviewing PRs, he is probably walking his dog.

name: Christoph Linse
bio: I am running kubernetes/openshift at several customers in Switzerland . I visit Cncf meetups in Switzerland. I have many years experience with devops/gitops and software development.

name: Christophe Kamphaus
bio: I’m an experienced DevOps Architect with extensive knowledge in modern Cloud Native technologies and heterogenous deployments. Adept at deep diving into complex issues I can develop innovative answers to them. Contributing to OpenTelemetry Semantic Conventions I help advance the field of CI/CD. A strong communicator I’m dedicated to empowering colleagues and clients through effective and efficient solutions.

name: Christophe Sauthier
bio:
Christophe leads the training and certification programs for the CNCF.

In his role, he makes sure that the courses, training and certifications offered by the CNCF are following and reflecting the fast evolving Cloud Native ecosystem.

Christophe is a seasoned Open Source veteran with more than 20 years of experience acting both in the community (Ubuntu, OpenStack, Cloud Native…) and professional services.

He started and lead « Objectif Libre » a successful French company that was delivering services and trainings (35% of their activities) on Open Source technologies (mainly Cloud Native and OpenStack). He is also the co-creator of CloudKitty, the rating component of OpenStack. Following acquisitions, he then worked for Linkbynet and Accenture.

Living in Montreal but originally from France, he enjoys spending time with his wife and kids to discover their new region. He can also be found around basketball courts, his other great passion.
company: Cloud Native Training and Certifications Lead

name: Christopher Adigun
bio:
As a Cloud Native Telco Architect, I specialize in designing telecommunications networks using Kubernetes and related software.

My expertise includes advanced Kubernetes networking solutions like Multus, Whereabouts, SRIOV-Device-Plugin, Spider-Pool, and Userplane Acceleration (DPDK).

I'm passionate about sharing my knowledge and have created a Udemy course on Kubernetes networking (https://www.udemy.com/course/kubernetes-baremetal-networking-using-gns3).

Additionally, I create content about Kubernetes-related topics on my Medium blog (https://medium.com/@futuredon) and YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAdwhfPswT1hDezzRGnTKg)

name: Christopher Duffy
bio: Chris, or know to his friends and coworkers as Duffy, is a dedicated architect who helps businesses seamlessly migrate and optimize their operations in the cloud. Passionate about CNCF technologies, CI/CD, containerization, and orchestration, he leverages these tools to transform systems for increased scalability and agility. A lifelong learner, Duffy constantly experiments with and adopts cutting-edge technologies, ensuring his clients' cloud journeys remain future-proof.

name: Christopher Hanson
bio: I have taught hundreds of DevOps engineers at Fortune 100 companies how to successfully use Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift, Prometheus, Istio, Spinnaker and other cloud-native tooling to package, deploy, and orchestrate microservice applications at scale. I give frequent talks at industry conferences to share my expertise with the community and write technical blogs with the RX-M team at https://rx-m.com/blog/.
company: RX-M Cloud Native & AI Consulting and Training

name: Christos Markou
bio: Software Engineer with main focus on observability and cloud native technologies. Eagerly working on OpenTelemetry project as an active contributor (and area specific approver) with the ambitious goal of making it the next generation Observability standard. Interested in everything around infrastructure, Kubernetes and containers. KCD Athens organizer.

name: Claudiu Avatamanitei
bio: I am an experienced IT professional with a strong background in design and implementation of complex software platforms, reliability and observability engineering, and defense in depth security. I am currently focused on enabling digital and cloud-native transformations at scale in the mortgage servicing business, by providing harmonious foundational technology ecosystems composed of vendor neutral, CNCF managed open source de facto standards. With extensive hands on expertise in Kubernetes (EKS, OCP), Istio, GitOps and ArgoCD, OTEL and Kiali, IaC (Terraform, Crossplane, Spacelift, Puppet), software development (Python, Java, C++), and several CI/CD platforms, I enable teams to focus on business value delivery and ensure low stress, successful development and operations of comprehensive software platforms.

name: Clay Lu
bio: I am a continuous learner with most of my experience in AWS and some experience in data engineering. I am also very interested in Kubernetes, ArgoCD, and Istio.

name: Cláudio da Silva Pinheiro Júnior
bio: I am a DevOps and Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with extensive experience in designing and maintaining scalable and secure infrastructure on Kubernetes, leveraging CNCF technologies such as ArgoCD, Crossplane, and Prometheus. I specialize in Infrastructure as Code (IaC), GitOps, and cloud-native solutions, working across platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP, and Oracle Cloud. My expertise extends to managing Kubernetes clusters (EKS, AKS, GKE, and more), automating deployment pipelines, and ensuring high availability and disaster recovery strategies.

name: Cody Galloway
bio: Cody is a Senior Event Planner with a focus on Content at The Linux Foundation, and manages the speakers and content for KubeCon + CloudNativeCon events. Prior to joining The Linux Foundation, Cody brings over six years in the event industry and has assisted planners in over one hundred corporate events.

name: Colin Tan
bio: Hi. I’m Colin, a DevOps engineer at GovTech. I love all things cloud native.

name: Craig Box
bio:
Craig is Senior Director of Developer Relations at cloud-native application networking company Solo.io, and a Steering Committee member for the Istio project.

Prior to Solo, Craig had a number of roles at Google, including leading Google's participation in Istio, Head of GTM launching GKE, and leader of the Cloud Native developer relations team, responsible for Kubernetes, GKE and Anthos. He was the founder and co-host of the Kubernetes Podcast from Google, producing the top 20 show for over four years.

Craig has worked with Cloud Native customers and communities since the launch of Kubernetes in 2014, and has delivered talks on 6 continents, including a KubeCon keynote. He started his career when DevOps was called ‘systems administration’, and has 20 years of experience in development, deployment, DevOps, consulting, advisory and management roles around the world.

name: Cristher Castro
bio:
Cristher Castro, co-founder and COO of Cuemby, is a visionary leader and operational dynamo who drives community building in the Latam tech scene. Over the last 3 years, she advocated for the adoption of open-source technologies within the Spanish-speaking community, creating and supporting tech meetups and events in the region. She co-created, along with her team, the first Kubernetes Community Days in Colombia. This event paved the way for the expansion of Cloud Native Groups throughout the region. Cristher's foresight and operational expertise have been fundamental to the success of both Cuemby and the Cloud Native Latam Group. Recognizing the region's need for in-depth knowledge of cloud-native applications, Cristher championed the LFS250 (Linux Foundation Course) and administered the KCNA certifications donated by CNCF to the region. These two initiatives heightened awareness of cloud-native technologies and certifications, fortifying local proficiency in open-source solutions. She continues to promote and advocate for the recognition of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) in the region, addressing both business and community aspects. Cristher's leadership and operational prowess exemplify her unwavering commitment to fostering a thriving Latam tech community. https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-latin-america/ https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-medellin/ https://www.cncf.io/reports/kcd-colombia-2023/ https://www.cuemby.com/about-us https://www.linkedin.com/company/fundaci%C3%B3n-hispana-de-cloud-native/?viewAsMember=true https://community.cncf.io/cloud-native-colombia/ https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/kcd-colombia/?viewAsMember=truehttps://www.linkedin.com/showcase/kcd-colombia

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Becoming a CNCF ambassador empowers me to further my dedication to community growth in the LATAM region. I deeply believe that the region's success hinges on the symbiotic collaboration of professionals, students, and companies. It's this harmony that forms the core of my mission: to cultivate a thriving community ecosystem centered around open-source and cloud-native technologies. Through this role, I am positioned to amplify awareness about these technologies and the transformative opportunities they introduce. My operational and logistics expertise is set to facilitate more meetups and events, thus kindling the formation of new communities. Collaborating with fellow leaders and ambassadors provides a unique platform to unite our efforts, ensuring we collectively advance our shared vision.

name: Cristian Daniel Bayona
bio: Multicloud Cloud native apps deployment and security specialist. The events that I normally attend as speaker are app security ones AppWorld, CyberProtector and Segurinfo

name: Cristobal Nevares
bio: While relatively new to the DevOps profession, I have found a deep passion for all things Kubernetes and Cloud Native technologies with a focus on security, reliability, and cost optimization.

name: Daiki Takasao
bio: I'm a Japanese IT infrastructure engineer working at NRI. I work with CNCF technologies in building financial IT systems. I have been using Kubernetes, Linkerd, and Prometheus for many years and have sufficient know-how.

name: Damian Igbe
bio: Damian Igbe, PhD, has a doctorate in computer science. He is a Technical trainer and consultant with Cloud Technology Experts, Inc. Damian Loves helping and simplifying cloud native technologies for organizations, worldwide. Damian runs one of the largest Kubernetes meetups in Dallas, the Kubernetes and Cloud-native North Dallas. Damian loves running and has completed several marathon races.

name: Damian Szuberski
bio: Damian is an accomplished senior DevOps/SRE engineer renowned for designing and implementing secure, scalable solutions for large-scale distributed systems in the cloud. His expertise spans Cloud Native, Kubernetes, GitOps, Service Meshes, CI/CD, Serverless, and Observability.

name: Damien Jacinto
bio: I am a freelance cloud-native engineer and trainer based in France

name: Damien Obringer
bio: Damien is an experienced Solutions Architect currently working at PwC Luxembourg. He is passionate about designing and implementing scalable, highly available, and maintainable applications using .NET, Kubernetes, Helm, and other Cloud-Native technologies.

name: Dan Oliver
bio: Dan is a Technical Architect with extensive experience in developing software and cloud solutions for Financial Services, Automotive, and Retail sectors. Transitioning from a software development background into cloud-native DevOps and platform engineering, Dan is proficient with AWS, Azure, and Kubernetes, and keen to get stuck into code, driving innovation and efficiency in his field by creating valuable solutions.

name: Dana Fine
bio:
• Organize community opps • Organizer & Co-organizer of various developer events, and meetups on a monthly basis • Kickstarting, organizing and producing the 1st CNCF conference in Israel. • KCD Israel brings together DevOps, operations, and coding practitioners for a full day of sessions focusing on best practices in operations and systems engineering, topics critical to DevOps success such as logging, monitoring, testing and security. • Including activities such as: ◦ Monthly meetups ◦ empowering women ◦ Recruiting sponsorships ◦ leading opps

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Gives me the power to continue and even make bigger diffrence🐸

name: Dandan Liang
bio: Dandan is an associate professor in Pengcheng Laboratory and has more than ten years of experience in the field of communication technology. Her current research area is cloud native network technology.

name: Daniel Czerwinski
bio: Cloud Devops Engineer at Rackspace. Interested in all things Kubernetes, as well as GitOps tools like helm/fluxCD.

name: Daniel Dias
bio: Daniel Nunes Dias is a highly skilled Cybersecurity Specialist with over five years of dedicated experience in the cybersecurity field. Holding prestigious certifications such as a CISSP, CCSP, and CCSK, Daniel brings a robust expertise in cloud security, Kubernetes, and Azure to his work. Known for his ability to tackle complex security challenges, he is passionate about leveraging automation to streamline operations and enhance security practices.

name: Daniel Dias
bio: Hello! I’m Daniel, a software developer and AI researcher, a Brazilian located in Buenos Aires, Argentina, working for 15 years in building tools and APIs. I'm a Software Developer at Kubeshop and a doctorate student at the University of São Paulo. Computer scientist, father, husband, a fan of videogames, kung-fu, and science fiction.

name: Daniel Drack
bio: I'm Daniel Drack, a DevOps engineer and community organizer from Graz, Austria. I work as a cloud-native consultant, teach at an Austrian university of applied sciences, and currently run the local CNCF chapter in Graz. Additionally, I'm one of the founders of Cloud Native Austria, the association hosting KCD Austria. I love speaking at conferences and meetups, solving technical challenges, and being part of the cloud-native community.

name: Daniel Hawton
bio: Daniel is a Sr Software Developer at Solo.io with a focus in DevOps, and a maintainer with the Istio project. Prior to Solo, I was apart of SUSE Rancher.

name: Daniel Krook
bio:
Daniel Krook recently joined the CNCF to better serve maintainers and contributors to the community of 150+ hosted projects. He has been involved in the use, creation, and advocacy of open source technology for over 20 years. He partnered with the LF to establish the "Call for Code with The Linux Foundation" umbrella and has guided 16 projects through the process of joining the LF and using LFX tools.

He has built software end-to-end for a wide array of industries and earned certifications in cloud architecture, application development, and system operations along the way. Most recently, he worked at IBM as a principal engineer developing first-of-a-kind solutions that integrate open source technologies with commercial products and services.

Daniel has spoken at many open source conferences (including main-stage presentations at the first CloudNativeDay and the inaugural KubeCon), hosted dozens of meetups (primarily OpenWhisk, Cloud Foundry, OpenStack, and PHP), and has contributed to many technical blogs, videos, podcasts, articles, and books.

name: Daniel Oh
bio:
Daniel Oh is Java Champion and Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat. He works to evangelize building cloud-native microservices and serverless functions with cloud-native runtimes to developers. He also continues to contribute to various open-source cloud projects and ecosystems as a Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) ambassador for accelerating DevOps adoption in enterprises. Daniel also speaks at technical seminars, workshops, and meetups to elaborate on new emerging technologies for enterprise developers, SREs, platform engineers, and DevOps teams.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It will give me more opportunities to meet more technical folks who want to adopt/learn new cloud-native technologies and tools. Also, the ambassador makes me a more proactive person to evangelize non-tech people in terms of how/why they move forward to the cloud.

name: Daniel Risnes Dagfinrud
bio: I am a platform engineer from Norway. Working with Kubernetes and working with open source is my passion. I created and am currently maintaining https://github.com/deggja/netfetch

name: Danielle Cook
bio:
Danielle has worked in the cloud native industry since 2016 helping organizations adopt the technologies that make cloud native enterprise ready. She co-authored and launched the CNCF Cloud Native Maturity Model and continues to maintain it as part of her leadership of the CNCF Cartografos Working Group. Danielle is a co-author of the CNCF book Admiral Bash's Island Adventure with Phippy + Friends. She is currently focused on getting organizations to understand how cloud native achieves business objectives.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having been part of the cloud native community since 2016, I’m excited to welcome new members and help them understand how to participate. I’m particularly interested in becoming an ambassador to help all members do better at communicating why cloud native is not just technology, but makes innovation and business goals achievable.

name: Danilo Souza Silva
bio: Danilo is a Senior DevOps Architect at Amazon, specializing in AWS container solutions, Security and DevOps practices. With a Master’s in Computer Science, he leverages Infrastructure as Code to drive modernization and transformation in IT operations. His qualifications include an AWS Certified Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer and an extensive array of Kubernetes credentials from CNCF (CKA, CKAD, CKS, KCNA, KCSA). Danilo leads significant cloud migration projects across Europe, working with public sector entities to harness cutting-edge cloud solutions.

name: Danny Yang
bio: Agile explorers in the cloud native. Advancing steadily in the cloud field, offering precise and detailed solutions. Accumulating experience through practical application, propelling enterprises on their journey of digital transformation, while maintaining the initial spirit of explorers, seeking new opportunities in the cloud native.

name: Dat Diep
bio: I specialize in designing and implementing scalable and resilient software applications that serve thousands of users in real-time using CNCF technologies, particularly Kubernetes. I'm passionate about solving complex problems and improving developer experiences. I enjoy working on challenges related to containers and Kubernetes and am eager to contribute to the community and share my learnings.

name: Dave Zolotusky
bio:
Dave is an engineer in Spotify's Platform team, where his focus has been core infrastructure, the data platform, and Spotify's use of cloud services. A noted evangelist for cloud native and open source technologies, Dave spurred Spotify to join the CNCF and remain active in the community, launched the Stockholm CNCF meetup, and is both a CNCF Ambassador and a member of the KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Program Committee.

In his work at Spotify, Dave has been essential to the adoption of CNCF projects like Kubernetes, gRPC, Envoy, and OpenTelemetry, as well as experimentation with Service Mesh. Prior to his time with Spotify, Dave worked at AWS, at VMware on cloud management software, and at Microsoft on the Office team.

name: Davanum Srinivas
bio: Davanum Srinivas (a.k.a Dims) is a Principal Engineer with Amazon Web Services working on Kubernetes, containerd and related projects at CNCF. Dims is involved in various Kubernetes SIGs and working groups like the Architecture, Testing, Node, Infrastructure etc.

name: David AUFFRAY
bio: Community leader in my location, I have spent the last few years building cloud native infrastructures for my customers, animating the internal company community, and support others to pass the Cloud Natives certification exams. My passion are for all things about and around cloud native. I am focused on Virtualisation, Observability, GitOps, Event Autoscaler...

name: David Halfdan Haugli
bio: My name is David currently work as a SRE in a Software company, have a passion for Open Source Cloud-Native technologies like Linux, Kubernetes, Talos, Cilium, ArgoCD, FluxCD, Trivy and Falco and I often tend to get lost in OpenSource software and the Cloud Native Landscape but this is why I do what I do. Certified Nerd can't stop talking about containerization and why all companies that produce some kind of software needs to do Cloud Native Containerization as a bare minimum. I love new challenges both in terms of troubleshooting and figuring out how new technologies works.

name: David Lidevi
bio: DevOps Engineer with a Master's degree in Computer Science. Main interests include DevOps, GitOps and Cloud but also optimizing code by clever usage of data structures and algorithms.

name: David Mukuzi
bio: I'm a DevOps engineer that's driven by a deep-rooted enthusiasm for continuous learning and exploring emerging technologies

name: David Palilonis
bio: David is an Inside Sales Manager at The Linux Foundation, where he leads a team of sales representatives who promote The Linux Foundation and its Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).  He is a United States Navy veteran with 20 years of experience in Operations Management and Process Improvement. He has a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University and a Master of Arts degree from the Naval War College. He is passionate about tech sales and the role open source plays in cybersecurity, cloud native, and mobile technologies.

name: David Pech
bio: I help people understand and get on the cloud technologies preferably in the Kubernetes ecosystem. I am very passionate about producing quality software that can be operated by the teams that create it. I have more than 20 years of experience in SW development and infrastructure and hands-on experience in dozens of technologies. I don't blindly rush to new tech adventures, but I try to be reasonable, pragmatic, and security-aware. I love CNCF tools such as ArgoCD, Traefik, Knative, Prometheus, CloudNativePG and many others, as they enable you to take make a difference in real projects.

name: David Solis
bio:
I have extensive experience and specialized skills in IT strategy and leadership, as well as advanced degrees in Actuarial Science, Quantitative Finance, and Computer Science.

I apply my expertise in cloud-native technology, such as the Kubernetes ecosystem, machine learning, blockchain, and software engineering, to drive technological advancements in Mexico's financial sector.

I focus on developing solutions that address current needs and anticipate future challenges to improve financial services' stability, inclusivity, and efficiency.

name: David Stahl
bio: As a dedicated Platform Engineer, I specialize in building resilient, scalable infrastructure that powers seamless deployments and empowers development teams. With expertise in Kubernetes, cloud architecture, and DevOps practices, I’m committed to driving efficiency, automation, and security across platforms. Whether it’s streamlining CI/CD pipelines or optimizing container orchestration, I’m here to push the boundaries of what’s possible in cloud-native environments.

name: David Watts
bio: Hi there! I'm Dave, and I'm deeply passionate about all things CNCF, especially Kubernetes. I believe true leadership isn't about rank or authority but about the choice to look after the person to the left of you and the person to the right of you. My approach to DevOps is rooted in breaking down silos, emphasizing the importance of people skills and communication to foster trust and collaboration within teams. Ensuring that everyone feels supported and empowered to succeed is what drives me.

name: Davit Mumladze
bio: Davit is a DevOps Engineer with a focus on mobile and internet banking solutions, managing applications used by over two million users. He's expertise spans Kubernetes, cloud environments, and automation tools like Terraform and Ansible. He also excel in monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Datadog, Grafana, and Prometheus to ensure system reliability. As an Azure DevOps expert and cloud enthusiast, He actively engage in Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) technologies.

name: Deepak Gupta
bio: I am Deepak Gupta, a seasoned Cloud Migration Expert specializing in AWS and Azure cloud platforms. I have extensive experience in migrating applications from on-premises to the cloud, with a particular focus on containerization using Kubernetes. My expertise lies in transforming traditional applications into scalable and efficient cloud-native architectures. My work is instrumental in driving digital transformation and optimizing performance in the new cloud environment.

name: Deepesh Puthalath
bio: I'm Deepesh Puthalath, currently serving as a Technical Solutions Consultant at Hewlett Packard Enterprise. My professional focus lies in the exciting fields of AI and Machine Learning, where I work on supporting innovative solutions and driving technological advancements.

name: Dekel Malul
bio: Hello from Israel 🇮🇱! Passionate about community collaboration, I actively contribute to the Kubernetes community by sharing insights on cloud-native technologies through my blog. I currently work as a DevOps Engineer, with a strong focus on providing Kubernetes assistance and guidance to Israeli startup companies.

name: Denis Kovacevic
bio: As a Cloud Solution Architect with over 10 years of experience and a strong foundation in software architecture and engineering, I specialize in designing and implementing scalable distributed systems, including serverless architectures.

name: Denis Urek
bio: Denis Urek is a Development Engineer at Flint SI d.o.o., with a focus on DevOps, automation, and development. Having completed their Kubernetes certification journey, they are now expanding their cloud knowledge, starting with AWS. Passionate about ensuring systems run efficiently with excellent oversight, they thrive in automating processes to enhance reliability and performance. In their free time, they enjoy challenging games like CS2, Arma 3 and RimWorld, along with exploring new technologies, socializing with friends, and finding balance through hobbies that offer both excitement and relaxation.

name: Dennis John
bio: Dennis is a Technical Architect (Cloud / DevOps) at Infosys. In his role, he is responsible for designing and developing solutions for clients, mainly cloud and DevOps related. He specialises in cloud infrastructure, container orchestration, CI/CD pipelines and application modernisation. He is active in a number of tech meetups in his city, and actively promotes cloud-native and DevOps solutions. Open-source software is another thing he is very passionate about and he believes that the best comes from collaborating with others and giving back to the community, a way to create and learn together.

name: Devendra Dhoot
bio:
Devendra works as a Technical Architect with over 13 years of experience in the industry and is a seasoned DevOps professional. Passionate about cloud-native technologies, he has been instrumental in driving the adoption of Kubernetes and other CNCF projects within multiple organizations. His expertise lies in designing and building cloud-native solutions with Kubernetes across various platforms, addressing the complexities of modern systems.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am passionate about the cloud and the endless possibilities it offers for building complex, innovative systems. The CNCF democratizes cloud-native technology, making it accessible across all platforms and embodying the spirit of open-source collaboration that fascinates and inspires me. Serving as an ambassador for this vibrant community is a great honor and opportunity to contribute to its growth and innovation.

name: Di Xu
bio:
Di Xu is passionate about open source projects and get involved in. He is a top-60 code contributor in Kubernetes community and founds CNCF Sandbox project Clusternet. He is also an avid speaker and has spoken many times at open source conferences and meetups, including KubeCon, Open Source Summit, etc. Nowadays he is specialized in cloud native, Kubernetes and infrastructure.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I've been an active member of the Kubernetes community since 2016. I am eager to become a CNCF Ambassador to give back to the open source community and help drive cloud native adoption. My practical experience with CNCF technologies can provide valuable insights to users. As an ambassador, I look forward to mentoring new contributors, staying connected to the latest developments, speaking at events, creating tutorials, and connecting with the cloud native community. This role aligns well with my passion for open source software and interest in emerging cloud native technologies. I am excited by the opportunity to contribute meaningfully as an ambassador, share my knowledge with others and help advance the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Diego Armando Cuevas Marban
bio: Multicertified Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Technical Account Advisor with up to 10 years of experience designing and supporting highly available applications. As a seasoned Kubernetes administrator and multicloud architect, I'm a champion for unlocking the full potential of Cloud Native technologies across cloud environments. I'm also a FINOPS Certified Engineer, bringing expertise not just in cloud technologies, but also in optimizing cloud costs and maximizing business value. My experience bridges the gap between Google Cloud and its customers, with a particular focus on helping them deploy and manage their workloads using Kubernetes in a multicloud setting.

name: Diego Fernando Purca
bio: A professional specialised in infrastructure management, cloud, devops, middleware and open source technologies.

name: Dimitar Zahariev
bio: A passionate IT enthusiast with a strong focus on open-source and cloud-native technologies, he is constantly expanding his expertise through hands-on experimentation in his home lab. In addition to freelance consulting, he actively teaches and develops courses, specializing in areas such as operating systems (Linux, Windows), cloud platforms (Azure), container orchestration (Kubernetes), and DevOps tools and practices. As an openSUSE Advocate, he is committed to promoting the project and the benefits of open-source solutions.

name: Dinesh Gopathy Padmanabhan
bio: Seasoned Professional Services Consultant & Instructor, with expertise in Infra, Automation, Cloud and Cloud Native technologies. Highly experienced in Architecting, Designing and Implementing Virtualization, Cloud Management and Automation solutions for several major customers across ASEAN, Middle East and India. A former VMware Certified Instructor who has trained over 1000 students. Holds over 50 certifications in Virtualization, Cloud, Cloud Native and DevOps technology domains.

name: Dineshwar Kumar
bio: With over 19 years of experience in IT, I specialize in Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Cluster, Red Hat Linux, and Kubernetes. Throughout my career, I have taken on diverse roles, ranging from Linux Support Engg to Infrastructure Architect, excelling in scripting and automation. I'm passionate about learning new open-source technologies, particularly in the areas of DevOps, DevSecOps, and cybersecurity, staying ahead of industry trends to continuously improve my skill set and contribute effectively to innovative projects.

name: Dinuka Arseculeratne
bio: I have been in the software industry since 2007 across a variety of domains including financial, health, telecommunications. Love everything about technology working across domains from development, devops to SRE.

name: Dipesh Rawat
bio: Dipesh Rawat is an experienced software developer with expertise in Kubernetes, cloud-native development, and DevOps practices. His work encompasses CI/CD implementations and the creation of scalable, secure solutions. As an active contributor to the Kubernetes community, he is dedicated to advancing cloud technologies and sharing his knowledge to promote community growth and innovation.

name: Dirk Michel
bio: SVP SaaS and Digital Technology @ MYCOM OSI | AWS Ambassador. Talks Cloud Engineering, Platform Engineering, Release Engineering, and Reliability Engineering | https://medium.com/@micheldirk

name: Dmitri Telinov
bio: Curious and avid learner. If I'm not working on tasks, I follow tutorials and courses to gain more knowledge in DevOps area and make notes on my daily blog - https://www.qwerty.md

name: Dmitri Vorošnin
bio: I am a computer engineer with a keen interest in cloud-native technologies, particularly those under the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF).

name: Dmitriy Klimenko
bio: I'm a Lead DevOps Engineer with extensive experience in the fintech sector. My expertise lies in automating processes across both cloud and on-premise platforms. I thrive on implementing an everything-as-code approach to build robust, scalable, and reproducible environments. I'm passionate about optimizing workflows and leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance operational efficiency and drive innovation.

name: Dmitry Shurupov
bio: A co-founder of Palark GmbH. An Open Source and Linux enthusiast since 2001. An active member of Kubernetes SIG Docs and CNCF Glossary. Dmitry builds the community for werf, a CNCF Sandbox project for CI/CD. He also shares Kubernetes and cloud native-related news and tools in the Kubernative Telegram channel (https://t.me/kubernative).

name: Dmytro Babich
bio: I'm a DevOps Engineer with a passion for Kubernetes. I'm learning and developing my skills in Kubernetes deployment and management, and I'm excited to see how Kubernetes can transform businesses.

name: Dmytro Slotvinskyi
bio: As DevOps Engineer, I work with a team of professionals to deliver high-quality solutions for various clients using Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), GitOps I have successfully implemented and maintained multiple AKS clusters, automated deployments and configurations, and ensured security and compliance standards.

name: Doddy Kristianto
bio: I have worked in a telecommunications company for almost 19 years at a leading digital telecommunications company in Indonesia. I started my journey in the field of virtualization and cloud technology from 2015 until now. Physical to Virtual (P2V) and Virtual to Virtual (V2V) are the first experiences in virtualization projects that know the basics of cloud computing. I started planning, assessing and building cloud computing in my company since the end of 2019 by conducting several cloud technology assessment tenders and selecting hyperscalers (cloud provider) according to my company's use cases. our challenge is how we maximize the benefits of cloud computing by migrating monolithic applications to microservices from on-premises to cloud using hyperscaler, with microservices we will have agile delivery to support rapid Go to Market (GTM) from a business point of view, we can support multiple deployments or sprint releases according to the business requirements program every week, it is much easier to maintain our applications / services independently and much more. Therefore, we realize the need to have microservices knowledge by understanding in-depth knowledge of the Kubernetes Platform to support this so that we will have an agile environment that can support our business growth and provide added value and competitive advantage for digital transformation in our company. I started learning Kubernetes from 2022 until now to support all kinds of applications/services migrating to microservices in the cloud. by fully understanding this knowledge we can maximize the value of kubernetes to support our business in our company.

name: Don High
bio: I'm a Principal Customer Engineer at Microsoft. Helping many ISV and Startup with OSS Kubernetes on Azure.

name: Donald Liu
bio: Donald is a Developer Evangelist for CNCF in the China region, helping companies and members to take part in the CNCF ecosystem, The Linux Foundation, and the bigger open source community.

name: DongGuk Seo
bio: Hello! I'm working as a junior DevOps engineer. I've had experience with a variety of technologies such as Kubernetes, Helm, Fluent-Bit, Harbor, Prometheus, and Apache Kafka. Lately, I've been very interested in other projects within the CNCF ecosystem, as well as in SRE and DevSecOps. Thank you!

name: Dongmin Han
bio: Hello, I am currently working as a System Engineer at NAVER Cloud. I have a strong interest in DevOps and Kubernetes. I am also passionate about automating repetitive tasks and solving problems.

name: Dotan Horovits
bio:
Horovits lives at the intersection of technology, product and innovation. With over 20 years in the hi-tech industry as a software developer, a solutions architect and a product manager, he brings a wealth of knowledge in cloud and cloud native, DevOps practices, open source and more.

Horovits is a public speaker and thought leader in the fields of DevOps, open source and specifically observability, having been on stage at KubeCon, Open Source Summit, FOSDEM and more. He also runs the popular OpenObservability Talks podcast, and you can also follow his blog and articles.

Horovits has been a leader in the Israeli community, an organizer of the CNCF chapter in Tel Aviv, and an organizer of the Israeli editions of Kubernetes Community Days (KCD), KubeDay and DevOpsDays.

  • Podcast: podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/openobservability
  • Blog: medium.com/@horovits
  • YouTube: youtube.com/@horovits
  • Sessionize: sessionize.com/horovits

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I've been advocating for open source and for the cloud native stack for years, online, on stage and with local communities, and I'm looking forward to expanding this activity as a CNCF Ambassador.

name: Douglas Luna
bio: Douglas Luna, a passionate Cybersecurity Specialist, brings his expertise in Kubernetes, Cloud Security and DevSecOps to highly regulated environments. Since discovering CNCF technologies in 2019, he has started learning about and actively contributed to the community by organizing KCD São Paulo (Brazil) in 2024. Share his knowledge journey at blog.douglasluna.com - feel free to get in touch!

name: Duffie Cooley
bio:
Duffie is a member of the CNCF Technology Oversight Committee and speaks on a number of topics ranging from Kuberenetes to security and networking.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador as I really enjoy helping others navigate our community. Helping them feel welcome and learning from them as we all lift each other up!

name: Duncan Wright
bio: DevOps Engineer with a background in Data Management Consultancy. I'm passionate about Kubernetes and cloud native technologies, and act as the chair of our internal Kubernetes Working Group. Recent projects I have worked on involved the implementation of GitOps practices using Flux, and establishing a service mesh with Istio. I work extensively with Terraform in Azure, and have helped build out data platforms across Snowflake and Databricks.

name: Dzung Vo
bio: Certified as an Azure DevOps Expert, Azure Solutions Architect Expert, AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional, and Kubestronaut.

name: Ebin Babu
bio: I'm Ebin Babu, an engineer turned event organizer on a mission to ignite the cloud-native revolution in Kerala. As a passionate evangelist in the open-source world, I juggle multiple roles – from heading operations at Stackgenie.io to co-founding devopsmalayalam.io and spearheading the CNCG Trivandrum chapter. My overarching aim? To cultivate a vibrant, collaborative cloud-native community in our dynamic state. Throughout my journey as an organizer, I've orchestrated over 100 online and offline events, fostering connections and exchanging knowledge among fellow cloud-native enthusiasts. It's been incredibly rewarding to witness this community flourish and expand. Together, we're nurturing a shared passion for open-source, Linux, Kubernetes, and the ever-evolving world of Istio. What truly fuels my drive is the diverse tapestry of minds within our community – constantly pushing boundaries and shaping the future of technology. I derive immense satisfaction from uniting these innovators and providing a platform for collaboration, ideation, and collective growth.

name: Edgaras Apsega
bio:
I am a passionate technologist with a focus on cloud-native technologies, particularly Kubernetes. As a co-organizer of Cloud Native Lithuania Meetup, I have helped to build a strong community of like-minded professionals where everyone is sharing their own experience. In addition to my meetup involvement, I am a speaker at technology conferences and currently work as an SRE at Vinted, where I bring my expertise in Kubernetes to help ensure the reliability and scalability of our systems.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because it enables me to connect with like-minded other ambassadors, share our knowledges and expertise and will help to educate and promote cloud-native technologies to a wider audience. The role also provides access to exclusive events and resources, as well as opportunities for professional growth and career development. Overall, being a Cloud Native Foundation Ambassador is a great way to give back to the community!

name: Edik Mkoyan
bio:
I run the infraheads DevOps agency where I also lead the development of our turnkey Kubernetes cluster management toolset called turnk8s showcased on awesome-talos repository. I blog mostly here https://medium.com/@info_98249

In the early 2020s, I actively advanced the DevOps movement in Armenia while overseeing Cloud and DevOps at EPAM Armenia. My leadership in DevOps engineering and abiding interest in AI led me to MLOps and now we partner with Netris, DVC and Outbound for OnPrem AI infrastructure deployment and management.

name: Edith Puclla
bio:
Edith is a Tech Evangelist at Percona Corporation, an open source contributor, and Docker Captain. She is a Docker and Kubernetes enthusiast who loves to create visual content. She became certified in KCNA and created a guide for others to become certified, too https://github.com/edithturn/KCNA-training. She also was a speaker at Docker Community All hands # 7, where she shared her experience in creating a Docker extension for Hoppscotch https://www.youtube.com / watch?V=uGADVJTodYE&t=14s

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because I like exploring the CNCF ecosystems and having fun doing it. It's also rewarding to share content with the community and meet people from all over the world. Thanks to the community, I have obtained many opportunities in my professional career, and now it is time to give back.

name: Edson Ferreira
bio: Currently working as an SRE, he is passionate about open-source communities and the cloud-native universe. He has already organized meetups for Docker, Hashicorp, and other local communities, in addition to having participated in the organization of DevOpsDays in Fortaleza (Brazil). He also loves writing blog posts on his blog (edsoncelio.dev) and speaking at community events. He is currently one of the maintainers of the Kubernetes documentation and the CNCF glossary in Portuguese (Brazil) and is part of the AWS Community Builder and Grafana Champions program. In his spare time, he divides himself between traveling, visiting cool restaurants, and watching and playing tennis.

name: Eduardo Nazareno Anselmi
bio: 🧑‍🎓Graduated from the National Technological University (UTN - FRBA - Argentina) and specialized and certified in multiple technologies (AWS, Kubernetes, Redhat, Fortinet, Terraform, to name a few of them). With more than 15 years of experience, I have provided optimal and tailored solutions for every need for all my customers.

name: Edvard Gogidze
bio: I am a backend engineer and DevOps specialist with a strong background in cybersecurity. I hold the SANS University Elite Cybersecurity Professionals challenge coin, reflecting my expertise in securing systems. My work involves developing efficient backend systems and implementing advanced DevOps practices to streamline and secure deployment pipelines. Passionate about programming technologies and DevOps, I continuously seek to enhance software development and operational processes.

name: Eleni Grosdouli
bio: The go-to person for DevOps and Kubernetes Automation, with a passion for networking, security, endpoint management, and endpoint security, Eleni brings a diversity of experiences to her role as a DevOps Consulting Engineer at Cisco Systems. Always eager to learn, she enjoys trying out the newest tech in a home lab and writing blog posts about her experiences. At this point in time, she is an active contributor to the ProjectSveltos. Beyond tech, she is all about sports and recently joined a local Rugby team. Medium: https://medium.com/@eleni.grosdouli

name: ELMUSTAPHA HTIOUI
bio: I am DevOps engineer working on different platforms, such as Kubernetes Vanilla distribution. I am migrating some workloads running in virtualization platform to a targeted Kubernetes platform. I am also implementing service and environment pipelines to facilitate code feature deployment in the targeted platform. While doing so, I use Tekton for service Pipeline and ArgoCD for environment Pipeline. I am eager to learn more technolgies related to the Kubernetes ecosystem.

name: Elna Vogel
bio:
Elna is a Meeting & Event Planner at The Linux Foundation, mainly working on CNCF events, and managing events with Chinese aspects.  

Elna has extensive track records leading cross-functional events globally. Prior to joining the Linux Foundation, Elna produced and managed corporate events for Fortune 500 investment banks in Hong Kong such as State Street, Goldman Sachs and BNY Mellon. Fluent in English, Mandarin and Cantonese, she works effortlessly across all regions, countries and cultures.

name: Elyes (Mohamed) JABRI
bio: a "certified Kubernetes engineer" with a strong background as a Linux sysadmin. I have extensive experience in designing, deploying, and managing scalable containerized applications, expertise also includes cloud technologies, infrastructure automation, and ArgoCD's GitOps best practices.

name: Emily Fox
bio: Emily Fox is a DevOps enthusiast, security unicorn, and advocate for Women in Technology. She promotes the cross-pollination of development and security practices. She has worked in security for over 13 years to drive a cultural change where security is unobstructive, natural, and accessible to everyone. Her technical interests include containerization, least privilege, automation, and promoting women in technology. She holds a BS in Information Systems and an MS in cybersecurity. Serving as chair on the Cloud Native Computing Foundation’s (CNCF) Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and co-chair for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon China 2021, Europe 2022, North America 2022, Europe 2023, and CloudNativeSecurityCon 2023, she is involved in a variety of open source communities and activities.

name: Emin Alemdar
bio:
Emin is working as a Solutions Architect and has undertaken tasks such as producing solutions related to Kubernetes, Cloud technologies and Cloud Native Transformation in general, and transferring best practices about these areas. He is also an AWS Container Hero and shares his experience with the community around these technologies. He is part of the organiser team of the official CNCF Istanbul Community Chapter (https://community.cncf.io/istanbul/). He is also part of the CNCF Glossary Turkish team and helps the local community to understand the Cloud Native terms in their native language. He publishes blog posts from his personal Medium page (https://medium.com/@eminalemdar) and also participates in Open Source and Cloud Native related conferences and delivers talks about these technologies. He is in the organiser team of KCD (Kubernetes Community Days) Istanbul conference.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Community activities have always been my biggest motivation throughout my career. Helping people and learning from the people by participating in community activities is extremely important for me. Cloud Native Community is really one of a kind and being part of this community is really like a dream coming true for me.

name: Emmanuel Mendoza Sosa
bio: Emmanuel is a seasoned DevOps and Site Reliability Engineer with over a decade of experience across finance, retail, media and supply chain industries. He specializes in Cloud, Infrastructure as Code and Kubernetes, with a strong passion for collaborating with development teams to solve and debug complex problems. Emmanuel likes to learn open-source technologies that enhance and contribute to the DevOps ecosystem.

name: Emmanuel Torrado
bio: I'm a regular guy who just loves tech, crypto, series and spend time with family and friends, i enjoy work as much as hanging out with them, father of 2 cats and a dog!

name: Emrah Sifoğlu
bio: My DevOps journey began with the question: "How do you check the logs of a running container on Kubernetes?" That conversation with infra engineer gave me a new perspective which led me to pursue DevOps. Now, I create CI pipelines on GitLab and automate tasks using Ansible. Becoming Kubestronaut is not only an achievement but also the beginning for me to deepen my knowledge.

name: Emídio Neto
bio: Emídio is a Site Reliability Engineer. He holds a Master's degree in Computer Science and has experience in software and infrastructure development, working on the conceptualization, design, and building of scalable solutions and architectures for cloud-native CPaaS/SaaS industry applications. Besides coding, Emídio has experience as a teacher, and he loves diving into local community projects and teaching. Emídio is also the Chapter Lead of the Cloud Native Community Group in RN/Brazil.

name: Enzo Venturi
bio: Linux, Networking and Go

name: Eric D Schabell
bio:
Eric is Chronosphere's Director Evangelism. He's renowned in the development community as a speaker, lecturer, author, baseball expert, and CNCF Ambassador. His current role allows him to help the world understand the challenges they are facing with observability. He brings a unique perspective to the stage with a professional life dedicated to sharing his deep expertise of open source technologies and organizations. More on https://speakerhub.com/speaker/eric-d-schabell

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to officially have the title of ambassador as I've been actively promoting a lot of the work they do for over a decade now.

name: Eric NG
bio: Senior Business Architect in VMware. Over 20 years in IT/Networking. Specialized in DCN, DC Security and Modern Application.

name: Erin Boyd
bio: Erin is currently the Director of Emerging Technologies  and Distinguished Engineer at Red Hat in the Office of the CTO. Erin was previously an Apple Cloud Services Engineer at Apple. Erin is a Kubernetes contributor and an Apache Ambari committer. Erin is an active contributor to the Kubernetes Storage SIG and is currently the co-chair of the CNCF Storage SIG. Erin’s main focus today is centered around how to enable storage in a stateless, hybrid, multi-cloud environment. Prior to working at Red Hat, she worked at IBM for 14 years. Erin worked in embedded systems development for several years before moving into global enterprise level services. Erin lives outside of Bozeman, MT with her husband and 5 children. She is a robot enthusiast and FIRST robotics mentor. Her family owns and runs a karate dojo in which they volunteer a considerable amount of time to teaching and empowering all people, especially women and children. And in what spare time she has, she runs marathons.

name: Erin Colvin
bio: Erin is an experienced Event Manager with a specific expertise in Tradeshows and Conferences. She has a passion for strategic event marketing, strong vendor relationships, and delivering exceptional experiences. She earned her Bachelor's degree in Communications and Business at the University of Utah, and began her career in sales and marketing. She managed 20+ tradeshows annually for a CPG company, before moving to the agency side where she mastered her Project Management and Customer Services skills managing experiential marketing campaigns for clients like Amazon Fresh and Kodiak Cakes. She recently received her Master's degree in Strategic Communication and is excited to utilize this knowledge to bring more research, data and strategy into her projects and events.

name: Erlend Leiknes
bio: Hi, I'm Erlend, a security conultant and pentester from mnemonic. I set out to learn Kubernetes from the ground up to effectivly navigate, hack and secure clusters. Now, I can become cluster administrator before lunch.

name: Esra Siegert
bio: I’m a system engineer with several years of work experience. My main focuses are Kubernetes, ArgoCD and Crossplane.

name: Etienne EHRHARDT
bio: After more than ten years of experience in infrastructure and middleware integration in various environments, I've naturally shifted to the cloud native world by more specifically focusing on container platforms. During the last years, I've acquired solid skills in designing and setting up cloud-native oriented architectures relying on various container engines, OpenShift and Kubernetes. The main focus being integrating those complex platforms in on-prem trusted, secured and compliant environments, as well as designing more hybrid setups in AWS and Azure. Those state of the art container platforms bring tremendous agility features to micro services integration, but there are nothing without proper governance and without using the right tools sets depending on a wide range of contexts and use cases. The cloud native world and its vast eco-system is evolving at high pace and today's challenge for many companies is to make sure they're not outrun by this strong wind of change in the digital transformation race. It's furthermore also important to understand all those concepts, the way they interact and their many impacts.

name: Ettore Ciarcia
bio: I work as a Cloud and Kubernetes Engineer. I handle migrations to major cloud providers and design cloud-native architectures, always promoting open-source software and minimizing vendor lock-in. I primarily work with technologies such as Kubernetes, Terraform, Prometheus, Grafana, Velero and Nginx, which allows me to build scalable architectures, optimize costs, and use a declarative approach. Participating in events like KubeCon, KCD Italy, and Linux Day in Benevento every year, both as an attendee and a speaker, has given me the opportunity to meet extraordinary people.

name: EunMi Kim
bio: I am an engineer working in cloud server operations with a strong interest in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies. I am continuously improving my skills to work with related technology stacks in CNCF.

name: Evangelista Tragni
bio:
Kubestronaut and vExpert 2024 KCD Italy Organizer Linux Foundation Authorized Instructor - VMware Cert Instructor - AWS Champion Authorized Instructor

CNCF Member , CNCF Speaker , Linux Day Puglia Speaker, Linux Day Basilicata Speaker, CometoCode member and speaker, AWS Meet up member, AWS Community member , Kubernetes Community Days Italy Organizer, The development of a career and a reputation as a reliable computing professional in both the creative and technical sides of IT, building on my technical knowledge of software, hardware and computing standards. I also aim to obtain a good and professional reputation as a world wide known IT trainer for Kubernetes , AWS, VMware and possibly others such as Google and so on.

Loving also to build knowledge sharing my consideration and my expertise and gaining knowledge from the students.

Hope to see you soon, never stop , keep studying.

name: Evans Amoany
bio: Have a strong passion for automated, highly available, optimized and secured clusters and systems. A DevOps advocate, opensource enthusiast, a Linux/GNU geek who continually studies, researches, and improves in these areas. A trainer and Author by passion.

name: Even Åge Smedshaug
bio: With a masters in Cybernetics and precious little Cloud Native experience, Evens passion for technology and fervor in the face of challenge propels him head first into the Cloud Native and Open Source ecosystem, starting with (according to him) the coolest certification of them all: Kubestronaut.

name: Eyal Zekaria
bio: Coming from a background of DevOps and SRE, where I operated Kubernetes clusters at scale on different cloud providers, I currently work as a Cloud Architect where I help other companies on their cloud journey. Automation is a topic that's close to my heart, as well as open source software.

name: Fabian Dohmen
bio: I work as a principal consultant in the AWS field and focus on the infrastructure side. My primary stack mostly contains AWS, CNCF projects and the hashicorp products.

name: Fabrizio Sgura
bio: Committed to innovation and new technologies, strong believer in cloud native and container orchestration. Participating in main events, both as speaker and attendant, actively spreading the CNCF principles and project. My job is my favorite game.

name: Fadi Dasus
bio: Fadi is a cloud security architect with extensive experience architecting and securing cloud technologies. His research and passion have concentrated on implementing zero trust architecture into Kubernetes and cloud environments, aiming to enhance the security posture within the cloud landscape.

name: Faeka Ansari
bio: Faeka dove into the world of cloud-native projects during her student days, and the thrill of it has kept her hooked ever since. Originally drawn in by the technology, she quickly discovered that it was the people in the community who made it truly special

name: Fangel Emilio Colón Navarro
bio: Hello, I'm Fangel, I live in the Dominican Republic. My first steps using CNCF technologies began in 2020 when the technological world advanced significantly. As of today I have already achieved a lot of knowledge and my wishes are to continue in this wonderful world.

name: Faseela K
bio:
Faseela is a cloud-native developer, maintainer and steering committee member at Istio Service Mesh. She has served as the Program Chair for the Istio Meetups in 2023 including the IstioDays co-located with KubeCon Europe and NorthAmerica. She regularly contributes to the Istio blogs, helping all the latest news about Istio reach users and contributors worldwide.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having done the work of an ambassador for Istio for several years now, I look forward to continuing this work officially now, making use of the support CNCF provides. I would love to provide more support for the women in cloud native community with this new opportunity I am provided with.

name: Fazlur Rahman Khan
bio: I am a software engineer, consultant, and Trainer with more than 20 years of experience in the industry. I specialize in cloud-native application development and transformation, container solutions, DevSecOps, Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery implementations and Kubernetes Administration. I have authored few courses and I am the course maintainer of all the official Kubernetes Administrator, Developer and Security courses at The Linux Foundation. I am excited to teach the nitty-gritty of Kubernetes in a practical and relatable fashion.

name: Feynman Zhou
bio:
Feynman is a product manager for Microsoft Azure. He is also a maintainer for CNCF ORAS and Notary Project. He is a big fan of open source and has been contributing to multiple CNCF projects over five years. He is a speaker of KubeCon and enjoy technology advocacy. He also hosted several events, such as Kubernetes Community Days China, CNCF Webinar, and cloud native meetups.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I’m super excited to be part of the Cloud Native Ambassadors family. I would like to work with other ambassador peers to learn and share cloud-native technologies.

name: Firasat Hussain Mohammad
bio: With over 3.5 years of experience in container orchestration, deployment automation, and Kubernetes, I have developed a robust expertise in CNCF technologies. My specialties include managing infrastructure as code using Kubernetes, AWS, Terraform, and ArgoCD.

name: Florian Cartron
bio: I'm a Devops Engineer with a deep focus on Kubernetes and Cloud Infrastructure. Passionate about empowering others, I enjoy helping teams adopt scalable, resilient cloud-native solutions and stay at the forefront of cloud innovation.

name: Florian Feldmann
bio: Florian is a DevOps Engineer working fully remote for adconova in the small town of Kamen.

name: Fog Dong
bio:
Fog Dong, a maintainer of KubeVela, and a senior engineer at Alibaba Cloud. She has been actively involved in the open source community, particularly in the cloud native DevOps field. Fog is now responsible for building large scale application workflow for Serverless Application Engine Product in Alibaba, while she's also fully experienced on building cloud native CI/CD platform when worked at Bytedance.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: As an Ambassador of CNCF, I am excited to have the opportunity to promote and educate people about cloud-native technologies, which are shaping the future of computing. CNCF has a vibrant community of developers and tech enthusiasts who are passionate about advancing these technologies, and I am thrilled to be a part of this community. Additionally, as an ambassador, I will have the chance to connect with other like-minded individuals and share knowledge and ideas, which will help us all stay up-to-date with the latest developments in this rapidly-evolving field. Overall, I am honored to represent CNCF and am looking forward to contributing to the growth and success of this innovative organization.

name: Francesco Grimaldi
bio: I'm a Team Leader at Desotech, specializing in cloud-native technologies for over 5 years. I've been drawn to the CNCF for a while now, and lately, I've been diving into organizing meetups in Southern Italy, both online and in person, to talk about various CNCF projects. I've also been visiting high schools around here, trying to spark interest in cloud-native tech among young students. Sharing my knowledge and getting others excited about these innovative technologies is what I'm all about!

name: Francis Lance Arzadon
bio: I have extensive experience in IT, with a strong background in leadership and management, where I’ve navigated the challenges of delivering and maintaining IT infrastructure and operations. Recently, I shifted my focus to new areas of the software development lifecycle, particularly in building and delivering stable, secure, and sustainable architectures. I believe Kubernetes is one of the most significant technological advancements of our generation, providing invaluable support to organizations across diverse industries—an inspiration for my Kubestronaut journey.

name: Francisco José Fialho São João Pascoalinho
bio: A software engineer with a focus on Kubernetes, multi-cloud and security. Enthusiastic about DevOps, DevSecOps and Cloud-native approaches. Always learning and exploring the CNCF landscape.

name: Frank Murray
bio: Frank is a Senior DevSecOps Engineer currently working at PwC. He works primarily within the Azure cloud environment through Infrastructure as Code (IaC) pipelines along with seamless CI/CD application pipelines. With a keen eye for innovation and efficiency, Frank has been involved on several high-impact internal projects, driving significant improvements in deployment speed, reliability, and cost savings through right sizing resources.

name: Frankely Ortiz Catano
bio: Driven by a deep passion for technology's dynamic landscape, Frankely Ortiz Catano finds joy in pushing boundaries and continually venturing into uncharted territories. As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Royal Caribbean Group, Frankely's current focus centers around Kubernetes and the realm of automation.

name: François Meulenberg
bio: Engineer with a cloud-first mindset. Who always want to learn, improve and adapt. I love to work but I also love my time-off and be outdoors.

name: Frazer SADO
bio: I'm a seasoned DevSecOps engineer with 12+ years of experience, specializing in automation, security, and cloud infrastructure.My expertise includes operating Kubernetes clusters (GKE, Openshift, Onpremises), leveraging IaC tools (Terraform, Ansible, AWX, Gitlab-Ci...), and mastering cloud services from GCP and AWS.I have a proven track record of securing and automating deployments for major companies, driving technical innovation, and optimizing system performance and security.

name: Frederico Muñoz
bio:
Frederico started working with GNU and Linux in the mid-90s out of sheer curiosity, a decision that strongly influenced his life. Actively involved in the free software and open source community from early on, he made a path from programming and system administration towards data science, cloud computing and enterprise architecture. In recent years he has been actively involved in projects touching such diverse areas as Quantum computing, IoT, and analytics, and actively participating in the Kubernetes project as part of the Release Team, SIG Contribex, and others. He currently leads the Cloud and Architecture domain at SAS, for the South West & East Europe region. He holds a BA in Archaeology from the University of Lisbon, where he is an MA student and where he also took Physics.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I see being a CNCF Ambassador as a great opportunity to engage with others both in the technical aspects of cloud-native computing and in the many ways that those interested can become active members of the community. Cloud-native technology has largely been developed through open collaboration, and being an Ambassador is taking a step towards more visible participation in building the community - and learning from it.

name: Frédéric KLEIN
bio: I’m a Senior Solutions Architect at Red Hat with over 20 years of experience in IT and Networking, specializing in cloud-native technologies and modern applications. In my previous roles at Orange and VMware, I led large-scale transformation projects, designed resilient architectures, and automated deployments to drive technical innovation and optimize system performance. I share insights on my blog https://fklein.me and connect with professionals on https://fr.linkedin.com/in/fklein82 . Passionate about learning from the community, I stay engaged with the latest developments in the cloud-native world.

name: Gaber Senan
bio: Over 10+ years of experience in software using different technologies with solid experience in integration and middleware systems development. I gained experience in building multi tiers applications and enterprise level systems integration in different fields payment, government sectors. I participated in full system development life cycle .

name: Gabriel de Biasi
bio: Gabriel has a BSc and MSc in Computer Science, and his first career choice was teaching. Gabriel taught various CS classes at the public university before taking a more technical role. Gabriel worked as a software developer, DevOps engineer, SRE, and solutions architect, focusing mainly on AWS. His greatest strength is Kubernetes, which he has worked on since the first major version.

name: Gabriel Monge Sancho
bio: I am deeply passionate about Kubernetes and cloud-native solutions. I find immense satisfaction in leveraging these technologies to architect scalable and efficient systems that meet the dynamic needs of modern businesses.

name: Gael Hascoet
bio: Hi my name is Gael i'm 31 years old and i am French. I'm a Devops engineer since 6 years now and i worked with lot of big company like Societe General, SNCF, GRDF... The technologies i'm working on are Kubernetes, Jenkins, Ansible, Python, GIT, Terraform. About the cloud i'm essentialy on AWS. I love learning new technologies and i'm glad to be part of the kubestronaut program !

name: Garry Cairns
bio: Garry is a lead engineer at JPMorgan Chase, currently focusing on observability. He has over a decade of Python experience, and enjoys trying out other languages, learning fun things about statistics, and making bread in his spare time.

name: Gary Tong
bio: Gary is a seasoned Multi-Cloud Architect, demonstrating proficiency across Azure, AWS, GCP, and VMware platforms. In his role as a forward-thinking DevOps leader, he spearheads pioneering projects in containerization and infrastructure evolution. Gary is recognized for his exceptional problem-solving abilities in demanding business contexts. Furthermore, he serves as a dedicated Kubernetes instructor and influential author on LinkedIn, delivering engaging educational sessions and insightful articles.

name: Genki Matsuda
bio: I am working as a DevOps engineer. I have a passion for learning CNCF technologies. I am developing a platform for a generative AI using Kubernetes.

name: Geoff Loh
bio: Geoff is a Cloud Architect based in Auckland, New Zealand. He comes from a background of full-stack software development with commercial experience in the health and fintech industries. As he has progressed in his career, he has become immersed into the world of Cloud and DevOps where he has helped organizations deliver cloud solutions using best DevSecOps practices. Geoff enjoys making contributions to the community through blog posts, open source projects and presentations.

name: Geonwoo Myeong
bio: A Kubernetizen Traveling the CNCF Landscape

name: Georgi Hristov
bio: I am a junior DevOps that have been working with Kubernetes for the past year. Interested in specializing in cloud-native technology in general.

name: Georgy Charkseliani
bio: Bringing value in the healthcare compliance and finance sectors by traversing the Cloud Native landscape.

name: Gerard de Leeuw
bio: I'm always looking for challenges and enjoy solving complex problems, especially when you have to dig deep in order to solve them. I really like working with people that have different skills so we can help each other in improving ourselves and getting the best results. Currently trying to share my passion for IT at Myst with my colleagues and the cloud-native community.

name: Gerardo López falcon
bio: I'm Gerardo López Falcón, a Docker Captain and Google Developer Expert with a focus on cloud, DevOps, and Kubernetes technologies. I run Cloud Native Costa Rica and frequently speak at conferences like KubeDay and Scale21x, sharing insights on cloud-native development and CNCF tools like Kubernetes and Prometheus. I'm passionate about empowering developers to adopt best practices in containerization, observability, and security. You can find my blog posts on my blog https://gelopfalcon.medium.com and follow my contributions to the community on Twitter at @gelopfalcon.

name: Gijs Middelkamp
bio: Started in 2008 as a Software Developer and Linux Engineer. After a job switch in 2015 I grew to be a DevOps and Platform engineer position at my current company. We use Kubernetes as our own platform, but I also am one of the engineers who developed our own Kubernetes as a Service platform (PKE). I get energy from improving setups, training people and help others adopt the cloud-native thought.

name: Gim SeonGyeong
bio: Hello, I'm Gim SeonGyeong and I work as a DevOps Engineer. Recently, I've been focusing on effectively embedding DevOps in organizations, and I'm interested in infrastructure reliability and application design in cloud environments. I also have a strong interest in Kubernetes and its ecosystem, including ArgoCD and Grafana.

name: Giorgi Keratishvili
bio:
Giorgi is very actively participating in community He plays role as AWS Community Leader in Tbilisi also Ambassador for CD foundation, CNCF chapter lead also he conducts meetups to grow DevOps/SRE/Platform Engineering awareness in Georgian community.

All about kubernetes and cloud native

name: Giorgi Kvinikadze
bio: I am passionate about Kubernetes and Cloud Native , implementing multi-cloud solutions, prioritizing security, optimizing performance, resilience and costs.

name: Giovani Martins Pires
bio: I am a Solutions Architect currently working in the aviation industry. My first contact with Kubernetes was in 2019, and I have been actively working with it ever since, supporting both development and production environments. Since 2022, I have been deeply immersed in Kubernetes, mentoring four classes through a three-day Kubernetes workshop each, including presentations and demos for an internship program. I also led another mentorship initiative for the entire company, focusing on Kubernetes and open source culture. In addition to Kubernetes, I have worked with other CNCF projects, including Backstage, Dapr, Cilium, and OpenTelemetry.

name: Giovanni Lo Vecchio
bio: Infrastructure-oriented DevOps Engineer. As a Kubernetes Expert in SUSE, he mainly provides customer support for the SUSE NeuVector, Hosted Rancher, and Harvester products. Giovanni has always used open-source tools that are part of the CNCF landscape, making them part of various Companies' infrastructure and contributing to their development.

name: Given Qiu
bio: I specialized in IT industry for over 10 years. From virtualization to containerization, It changes a lot on development lifecycle. As a Devops Engineer, I am passionated on kubernetes and other projects like prometheus, ArgoCD. Also want to explore more and more in open source world in the future. Keep going and be curious.

name: Gnana Salten S
bio: I am an open-source enthusiast and cloud-native architect with a deep passion for CNCF technologies. I actively participate in Meetups where I share my knowledge and insights on Kubernetes, Prometheus, and other cloud-native tools. My specialties include designing scalable, resilient cloud architectures and contributing to open-source projects.

name: Goh Chun Wei
bio: Technically experienced architect with full stack development experience. Close to 20 years of working experience across startups, SME, MNC and Government agencies with last 5 years in the Cloud Native and DevSecOps paradigm.

name: Gregor Logar
bio: I am a DevOps engineer who is interested in everything related to Kubernetes. I have a passion for learning and exploring within the CNCF landscape

name: Grégoire Groison
bio:
I've been a Linux and Cloud-Native Engineer at Hexanet for 2 years with decades of experience. I carry out audits, troubleshooting and design highly available Kubernetes architectures for our customers. I am constantly looking for ways to improve my knowledge of Cloud-Native technologies.

Passionate about open source, I firmly believe in the power of the community to move technology forward.

name: Guillaume MAILHOL
bio: Young platform engineer working on innovation and improving developer experience. Passionate about new technologies and cloud native. Love to go to conferences like Kubecon, Fosdem, etc and local meetup. Rust && WASM Enthusiast. Strong belief in Kubernetes and cloud native as bests standards for platform engineering.

name: Guillermo Vigil Rodríguez
bio: Guille is a Platform Engineer focusing his professional path in cloud, infrastructure as code, Kubernetes and DevOps methodologies. Guille is constantly learning new technologies and trying to be up to date with latest news in the industry. Also Guille is certified in Kubernetes and a CNCF Kubestronaut; he is also certified in Terraform and in AWS with Practitioner, Solutions Architect Associate, SysOps Administrator Associate and Developer Associate. He enjoys his personal life drinking beers with friends, playing football in a team and listening electro music.

name: Gustavo Ivo Meira de Carvalho
bio: I have been working as an SRE and Platform Engineer Expert in OpenSource tools for Observability such as Prometheus, Thanos, Cortex, Grafana, tempo, loki, Jaeger, Alertmanager. I have more than 17 years in the IT area, experience in RISC and CISC architectures, VMware environments, I have worked in Disaster Recovery environments in public clouds and On Premises environments. Currently working in environments with Containers in Kubernetes.

name: Guy Menahem
bio:
Guy was fortunate enough to experience hands-on the entire evolution of cloud-native computing, from bare-metal servers to VMs and ultimately to Kubernetes. He is passionate about sharing his vast knowledge by writing blogs, speaking at global events, creating video content, and contributing to open-source projects by the CNCF. Guy has been dubbed "The Good Guy" by his peers and members of the community for his persistent desire to help others. It’s no wonder then that his day job at Komodor revolves around helping organizations to adopt K8s and solve the challenges that come with it, while his free time is dedicated to building a local community for Solution Architects and maintaining his educational Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@the_good_guy

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador because it allows me to further my mission of sharing knowledge and driving the adoption of cloud-native technologies. As an ambassador, I will have the opportunity to create more resources, collaboration opportunities, and initiatives with the community & end-users to promote adoption and innovation.

name: Hafiz Muhammad Junaid
bio: I’m a Cloud DevOps Engineer with all 5 Kubernetes certifications (a kubestronaut), specializing in cloud infrastructure automation, security, and CNCF technologies. I am passionate about integrating AI with cloud systems, currently working on AI-driven cloud infrastructure solutions. You can explore my work at https://medium.com/@junaid1210

name: Halil Ibrahim BUGOL
bio:
I started my career in a data center in Istanbul, Turkey. I have been interested in the CNCF world since 2018. Although my main areas are generally technical aspects, there were companies where I took part in community and product management. I am currently in the role of Co-Founder at Kubezy. Apart from the commercial side, we have been organizing events as Organizers at CNCG Istanbul since last year, together with my friends in Turkey. I am also a member of the KCD Türkiye team. I have a community role as Technology Evangelist at KubeSphere and KubeSphere Products.
