Julia Furst Morgado is a Global Technologist - Office of the CTO at Veeam Software. With over five years of experience in the industry, her focus is on simplifying Cloud Native technologies by sharing her expertise and experiences. She is also committed to empowering communities as the organizer of the NY Code & Coffee Meetup and KubeHuddle conference, and by being an AWS Community Builder, a Women Techmakers Ambassador and a Girl Code Ambassador.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I strongly believe in raising awareness about how people can help the CNCF community beyond just coding, and encourage more individuals to get involved in whatever capacity they can. I am excited to produce content, promote cloud native technologies, participate in major events, and connect with global communities.

name: Juliano Costa
bio:
Juliano is a passionate Software Engineer/Developer Advocate with extensive experience in cloud-related technologies. He is specialized in OpenTelemetry and is always working with Kubernetes, Helm, Containers, Jenkins, and other related tools. As one of the maintainers of the CNCF project OpenTelemetry Demo, Juliano has helped to create a distributed system that demonstrates the implementation of OpenTelemetry in a near real-world environment. With a strong belief in the power of community, Juliano co-founded the Cloud Native Linz meetup. He actively participates in the tech community and is always willing to share his knowledge and insights with others. When not working, Juliano likes to spend his time with the family traveling around Austria and sightseeing new places.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I strongly believe in the power of the community and how it can help everyone grow, not just professionally, but as a whole. I'm extremely excited about being able to help growing the CNCF community and raising it awareness wherever I go. I love learning and sharing what I learn. The atmosphere and environment of openness created by CNCF is something that I take with me in every interaction I have. I'm super excited and thankful in becoming a CNCF Ambassador.

name: Julien Sudan
bio: I am Julien Sudan, a Site Reliability Engineer with extensive experience in architecting secure, scalable cloud infrastructures and implementing DevSecOps and SRE practices. Currently working at Exoscale in Switzerland, I excel in using technologies like Kubernetes, and IaC to optimize cloud deployments across environment, whether on premise or in the Cloud. I actively contribute to the cloud-native community by sharing insights through presentations at conferences and wrote articles on different blogs. My technical proficiency and commitment to continuous learning are demonstrated by a comprehensive suite of certifications, including CISSP, Kubestronaut, and several cloud-specific credentials..

name: Julio Tencio Coto
bio: I am a passionate self-learner who began my tech journey as a network engineer before transitioning to Linux system administration, working with both physical and virtual machines. My interest in containers sparked a new passion, leading me to dive deeper into cloud-native technologies. Earning CNCF certification opened up exciting professional opportunities, allowing me to work on the cutting edge of technology and innovation.

name: Junichi Miyagawa
bio: I work as an IT infrastructure architect and Scrum Master. I have expertise in AWS, Azure, CloudNativeSecurity, Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code(AWS CDK) and Platform Engineering.

name: Junyeong Jang
bio: My name is Junyeong Jang, and I am a developer at BespinGlobal. I am passionate about leveraging Cloud Native technologies and artificial intelligence to create innovative and efficient software solutions. With a focus on continuous improvement, I aim to develop scalable systems that drive both performance and user experience.

name: Juraci Paixao Kröhling
bio:
I'm a software engineer building telemetry tools. I'm active in the OpenTelemetry community and have been one of the Jaeger project maintainers in the past, having also contributed to OpenTracing. I also love to spread knowledge about the tools I work with, having had the pleasure of speaking at KubeCon (EU and NA), OpenSource Summit (EU and NA), FOSDEM, Devoxx, among others. And more recently, I started a side project called Dose de Telemetria, where I create deeply technical content related to observability, monitoring, and telemetry in my native language, Portuguese.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Recognizing that language might be a barrier for people to understand the CNCF ecosystem and projects, I will focus on sharing knowledge in Portuguese. I'm also looking forward to fostering the ecosystem around our observability tooling, with a particular focus on OpenTelemetry but not limited to it.

name: Justin Cormack
bio: Justin is the CTO at Docker. He is passionate about software development, security, and the open source community.

name: Justin Dustzadeh
bio:
Justin Dustzadeh is the Chief Technology Officer at Equinix. In this role, Justin drives the company’s technology vision, strategy and architecture as well as the overall technical innovation and focus on software transformation and engagement within the developer community, including within the Linux Foundation.

Justin is an industry-recognized thought leader on cloud-native technologies and software-defined infrastructure and has a wealth of executive and technical leadership experience, including leadership roles at Uber (where he served as Head of Global Network & Software Platform), Visa, Huawei, Ericsson, AT&T, a technology startup which he co-founded, and two leading service providers in France.

He holds a Ph.D. and M.S. in Computer Science from Télécom Paris, and a B.S. in Theoretical Physics from École Normale Supérieure (Ulm) in Paris.

name: Justin Gilley
bio: I enjoy the continual process of rethinking technology to produce better software. Kubernetes is not just a container orchestration tool; Kubernetes is also a philosophy around how to build software for production. As a person who graduated with a degree in philosophy and later transitioned into tech, I appreciate technologies such as Kubernetes that envision a better future by rethinking the status quo.

name: Justin Poort
bio: I’m an passionated DevOps engineer who is currently working as an consultant. My specialty is Kubernetes but I also love working with almost everything that is IaC related.

name: Jérémy Albrecht
bio: I'm Jérémy, a former backend developer who has transitioned into the dynamic world of DevOps Engineering. I weave together Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker, Infrastructure as Code, Ansible and automation to create seamless, efficient solutions.

name: Kacper Lipka
bio: I'm a DevOps Cloud engineer with an interest in machine learning and automating everything I can. I specialize in cloud technologies, Infrastructure as Code, CI/CD and container orchestration. I want to constantly develop and seek new experiences. Discovering CNCF tools allows me to do just that.

name: Kai Genegabus
bio: Simple Cloud engineer. Enjoys Kubernetes.

name: Kaivalya Shah
bio: I am a DevOps consultant who specializes in Kubernetes, GCP, and AWS. I love to automate and codify as much as I can with any tools at hand. As an active member of many cloud communities and conferences, I love to discuss technical ideas and news. If I start talking about football or chess, I can't promise I will stop!

name: Kaiwalya Koparkar
bio:
I am a Computer Engineering student from India. I passionately advocate open source and tech. I am lead of cloud-native community group Nashik. I also run a blog site and youtube channel to educate people and students about CNCF tooling. http://community.cncf.io/nashik/ https://blogs.kaiwalyakoparkar.com/ https://youtube.com/@kaiwalya_koparkar

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador as it will help me reach out to more students and student communities and help them get their first steps into cloud-native. I believe students can bring much more value to the cloud native ecosystem and being a CNCF ambassador will enable me introduce more students to the ecosystem.
company: R. H. Sapat College of Engineering

name: Kaiwen Yang
bio: I am a product manager and have been engaged in the cloud native field for five years. I have a strong passion for cloud native technologies and open source contribution. I am a contributor of Kubernetes(SIG Docs), OpenKruise and KubeWharf. Beside the cloud native technology, my hobbies are marathon running and trail running, and have completed three times of 50km trail running.

name: Kannan N
bio: I’m Kannan, an experienced software engineer and cloud-native enthusiast with over a decade of innovation in the tech industry. My expertise as a DevOps engineer and cloud architect allows me to design and manage scalable, resilient, and efficient digital ecosystems. With a deep mastery of Kubernetes, I’ve helped organizations streamline operations and optimize cloud-native infrastructure. My passion for automation and cloud technologies drives me to constantly improve system performance and ensure high availability.

name: Karen Chu
bio:
Karen Chu is the Head of Community at Fermyon Technologies. Having participated in the cloud native community since 2015, she is a CNCF Ambassador, Helm community manager/maintainer, emeritus Kubernetes Code of Conduct Committee member, meet-up organizer, and conference organizer. She has also worked on The Illustrated Children’s Guide to Kubernetes book series. When she’s not connecting dots in the community, you can find her pursuing photography, cooking, and sipping on chai lattes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Having help build this community since 2015, I'm fascinated by how far the ecosystem has come and how much further it can go. I'm extremely excited to see CNCF participate in new spaces and so with my continued work as a CNCF Ambassador, I look forward to helping bridge the gap between the cloud native and Webassembly communities.

name: Karen Kostanyan
bio: I am a DevOps engineer specializing mostly in AWS and everything around Kubernetes, Have an adorable son and a beautiful family. Love swimming and skiing.

name: Karena Angell
bio: Karena Angell is a member of the CNCF Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) and was a Technical Lead for the CNCF Technical Advisory Group (TAG) App Delivery. She is also a Senior Principal Technical Product Manager at Red Hat focused on upstream projects, including Kubernetes. She has a broad background within various disciplines including Product Management, Enterprise Architecture, Enterprise Solution design and management, Marketing, IT Service Management and technical community building. She has also worked extensively within Commercial and Government enterprises. These experiences give her a unique understanding of how to guide strategic efforts to engage community members and drive increased CNCF involvement.

name: Karim Arous
bio: DevSecOps Engineer Location: Paris, France Project Experience: Kubernetes, Argo, Helm, Artifact Hub, Cert-manger, KEDA, External DNS, Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog, Kyverno With a passion for automating and optimizing development and operations, I specialize in implementing cutting-edge DevOps practices and cloud solutions. My expertise includes CI/CD, cloud infrastructure across AWS or Azure and leveraging tools like Docker and Kubernetes for efficient deployment. Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Since the beginning of my career, I always try to share knowledge with teammates or even my friends. Being an ambassador will help me reach more people around the world since sharing is caring. Just remember, together we rise

name: Karim BENMALEK
bio: I am a cloud native engineer with 4 years of experience, passionate about CNCF technologies and the Kubernetes ecosystem. I enjoy exploring related projects such as Helm, Argo, Kubeflow, and Crossplane to enhance my skills and knowledge. I focuse on designing scalable and resilient applications, as well as automating infrastructure deployment. My dedication to learning and improving makes me a reliable contributor to any cloud-native development team.

name: Karol Szymanowski
bio: I am a Senior Software Engineer specializing in TypeScript, AWS, and Kubernetes. My work revolves around designing scalable and secure web applications. Passionate about DevSecOps, I thrive on automating processes and I am a strong advocate for "self-driving" infrastructure.

name: Kashif Karim
bio: As a DevOps engineer with a passion for cloud-native technologies, I've spent the past few years honing my skills in deploying and managing applications. My recent collaboration with a government organization involved transitioning their applications from Docker Compose to Kubernetes, optimizing their infrastructure for scalability and reliability. Alongside my professional endeavors, I'm committed to mentoring and guiding individuals on the CNCF certification path, helping them navigate the complexities of cloud-native environments with ease. While I don't run Meetups or maintain a personal blog, I'm always eager to share my knowledge and experience with others in the community.

name: Kaslin Fields
bio:
Kaslin Fields is a Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, CNCF Ambassador, and a contributor to Open Source Kubernetes. She is passionate about making Cloud Native technology exciting and fun to learn for everyone from seasoned pros to total newcomers. In addition to her work supporting the development of cloud native technologies as a contributor, she also aims to spread the word about this awesome field by producing talks, videos, blogs, documentation, comics, and more.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: The Cloud Native ecosystem is active and growing, which can make it difficult for community members building awesome things to get the support they need. As an ambassador, I am passionate about providing support to folks building their own Cloud Native communities, technologies, and more.

name: Kasper Borg Nissen
bio:
Co-founder of the Nordic meetup alliance, Cloud Native Nordics, where he also organize the Aarhus group, and tries to help the nordic community as much as possible, e.g. setting up KCDs and more. Kasper also serves as Co-Chair for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon EU/NA 2024/2025. He works as Staff Platform Engineer at Lunar where he in the past has shared many experiences with Cloud Native tech at meetups and conferences. Kasper wrote his master thesis, “KubeCloud - A Small Scale Cloud Computing Environment”, on how Universities could leverage small-scale cloud environments built out of Raspberry Pis running Kubernetes.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm excited to be an ambassador, because it's a great community of like-minded people. I hope to meet and learn from the other awesome Ambassadors, and help grow the adoption of Cloud Native technologies even more here in the Nordics.

name: Kasun Rathnayaka
bio: Principal Engineer | Cloud Architect | Devops practitioner

name: Kate Qiu
bio:
Kate is a Senior Meeting & Event Coordinator, Sponsorship Management, at The Linux Foundation, helping with the fulfillment of sponsorship benefits for Kubecon + CloudNativeCon events.

Prior to her role at LF, Kate worked as a Marketing Operations Assistant for China Telecom Americas where she was responsible for their industry conference and tradeshow planning and logistics.
company: Senior Meeting & Event Coordinator, Sponsorship Management

name: Kateryna Firoozi
bio: Kateryna is an SRE/DevOps engineer with a deep passion for security and cloud-native technologies. She holds a Master’s degree in Information Security and brings over 10 years of experience in helping development teams accelerate secure and efficient product development using modern developer platforms.

name: Katie Gamanji
bio:
Katie is a cloud native leader, practitioner, and contributor, currently in a Senior Kubernetes Field Engineer role at Apple and a TOC for CNCF. As a cloud platform engineer, Katie has built the infrastructure for Conde Nast and American Express, gravitating towards cloud-native technologies, principles, and Kubernetes as the focal point. At CNCF (Cloud Native Computing Foundation), she was a Technical Oversight Committee member and led the CNCF End User Community. At present, Katie advises the Keptn startup and holds the Chief of Future Founders Officer (CFFO) position at OpenUK.

Recently, Katie released the Cloud Native Fundamentals course and led the creation of the CNCF KCNA (Kubernetes and Cloud Native Associate) certification. Additionally, Katie is an active keynote public speaker, a #TechWomen100 winner, and a strong advocate for women in STEM.

name: Katie Greenley
bio: Katie joined #teamcloudnative in 2015 as an Event Manager at The Linux Foundation. She was one of the lead producers for CNCF's cornerstone events, KubeCon + CloudNativeCon, and supported CNCF's third-party event engagements. With over 15 years of experience in event and community management and ten years in open source, Katie made a career change in 2022, joining the CNCF team full-time to lead community programs and marketing initiatives within CNCF.

name: Katie Meinders
bio: Katie is a Public Relations Manager for CNCF.

name: Kaur Kallas
bio: I have specialized on Kubernetes and the surrounding open-source technologies. Always prefer to take a cloud-agnostic approach, using operators like building blocks to solve problems with a emphasis on 2nd day operations. Big fan of Pulumi, Crossplane, and Argo projects

name: Keba Stalin Britto J
bio: I am an open-source enthusiast and cloud-native architect with a deep passion for CNCF technologies. I enjoy exploring cutting-edge CNCF tools, and my enthusiasm for Kubernetes runs deep. I specialize in designing scalable, resilient cloud architectures and contributing to open-source projects, all within an architecture predominantly based on open-source and Kubernetes, adopting the DevOps culture.

name: Keith Chan
bio: Keith (Chan Chak Fai) has been in IT industry for more than 20 years. He is born in HK and holds an MBA degree from UK. He started his IT journey from involving in IP stack network to focusing on IT security solution since 1997. He has been helping a lot of Enterprise in Asia Pacific to deploy security solution around the globe. Since 2009, he has also stepped into particularly Open Source Area. He has helped a lot of companies in Greater China for a better open source management and strategy, which covers Government, Banking and Finance, High Tech. He has successfully helped more than 40+ overseas companies to introduce their latest technology in Asia Pacific, as being the General Manager in Greater China. He is now the Director of Strategic Planning of The Linux Foundation APAC, helping The Linux Foundation to promote open source in Greater China.

name: Kemila De Silva
bio:
An experienced DevOps Engineer with a solid background spanning over 5 years, specializing in CNCF (Cloud Native Computing Foundation) technologies. I've excelled in developing and implementing robust infrastructures for seamless application deployment, with a focus on optimizing availability through industry best practices. Additionally, actively contribute to the CNCF community by organizing significant events like KCD Sri Lanka 2022, KCD Sri Lanka 2023, and hosting monthly Kubernetes Sri Lanka live streams on YouTube, fostering knowledge sharing and keeping professionals updated with the latest advancements in cloud-native technologies.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Each ambassador may have their unique reasons for their excitement, but the chance to influence, connect, contribute, and learn often serves as significant driving forces behind their enthusiasm for taking on this role.

name: Kevin (Zefeng) Wang
bio: Kevin Wang has been an outstanding contributor in the CNCF community since its beginning and is the leader of the cloud native open source team at Huawei. Kevin has contributed critical enhancements to Kubernetes, led the incubation of the KubeEdge, Volcano, Karmada projects in CNCF, actively participated in the TOC, and played a critical role in building and supporting the growth of CNCF technologies and the CNCF community in the globe.

name: Kevin Tijssen
bio: Kevin Tijssen is a Cloud Native Engineer at Fullstaq, specializing in Kubernetes, Infrastructure-as-Code, pipeline automation, and cloud technologies. With a wealth of experience in Cloud Native and DevOps roles, Kevin brings valuable expertise to Fullstaq. He is dedicated to driving cloud-native transformations and enhancing operational excellence.

name: Khalid Shaheen
bio: open source enthusiast

name: Khoi Luu
bio: A techie who has been diving into Kubernetes and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP, and Alibaba for over five years, and a big fan of Open Source and Cloud Native solutions.

name: Khushboo Khatter
bio: Hello! I'm Khushboo Khatter, an IT professional with over 8 years of experience. I have a passion for cloud technologies and enjoy exploring cutting-edge CNCF tools. My enthusiasm for Kubernetes runs deep, and I love diving into its complexities. Let's connect on LinkedIn and explore the exciting world of cloud-native technologies together! Feel free to reach out: www.linkedin.com/in/khushbookhatter

name: Kim Iversen
bio: Bergen based DevOps- and Cloud advisor with a deep passion for technology; from high abstractions such as Kubernetes, all the way down to bits and bytes. I love discussing this stuff as well, so hit me up if you want someone to chat or collaborate with!

name: Kim Sondrup
bio: He is a regular attendee at Cloud Native Aalborg and KCD Denmark and a passionate open-source evangelist. He started his journey as a developer and, later, in 2016, began working with Puppet; with that, he learned and enjoyed what would later be known as GitOps while he also experienced working with lots of Yaml and IaC. After that, he noticed that binary artifact distribution and management were an often overlooked field of expertise. That led him to later greenfield Artifactory for a large enterprise and get involved with everything around it, including its newest biggest user, the company's new Kubernetes clusters. A lot of Kubernetes and Cloud Native later, with some added certifications and today, he is an experienced Cloud Native professional and recognised Kubestronaut.

name: Kimi Huang
bio:
Kimi Huang, a Site Reliability Engineer and Cloud Solution Architect with a strong interest in Kubernetes and Public Cloud Technologies.

He is passionate about using cloud-native tools such as Kubernetes, Argo, Helm, Prometheus, and Istio in his daily life. Kimi enjoys making things as automated as possible via Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) concept. He also loves to share how to build a Robust, Scalable, Secured, and Highly Available system in the Public Cloud.

name: Kimihiko Abe
bio: I am conducting research and development on data processing infrastructure leveraging Kubernetes and accelerators such as GPUs and FPGAs.Additionally, I am working on Layer 3 network verification technologies utilizing container-based routing technologies.

name: Kiran Kumar Reddy
bio: DevOps enthusiast with focus on improving the processes and keeping the applications up and running in the production.

name: Kirill Andrienko
bio: Former Microsoft-stack infrastructure (Hyper-V, AD) teamlead eventually turned to the dark side, heard a lil bit of K8s and Linux with security on the first place, prone a bit to over-engineering: 20+ years of IT-experience total - so seen some shings, you know.

name: Kisung Yi
bio: Hi, my name is Kisung, and I am a Technical Support Engineer at Datadog. With a deep passion for containerization and Kubernetes technologies, I specialize in helping organizations navigate and succeed in their cloud journeys. I bring extensive experience in CNCF technologies and am dedicated to providing support and guidance to those facing challenges in the cloud. My goal is to empower others to achieve success and innovation in their cloud initiatives.

name: Kohei Ota
bio:
Kohei Ota is a Senior Field Engineer at Apple. He is a CNCF Ambassador and contributes to Kubernetes SIG Docs as the Japanese localization owner in the CNCF communities. He also organizes Docker Meetup Tokyo and CloudNative Days Tokyo; some of the biggest "container/cloud native" communities and conferences in Japan.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I've been involved with local cloud native community based in Japan. Unfortunately not many folks from Japan have tightened relationship with international community. I'm excited to be part of organizers of both sides and would love to help local experts become part of the international community!

name: Kolawole Olowoporoku
bio: Wearer of multiple hats. Engineer most times. Lover of Open source. I try to pen my thoughts whenever I get some time @koledev.com

name: Konstantinos Stavropoulos
bio:
I have been working with Containers & other Cloud Native technologies since 2020. I am passionate about Infrastructure-As-Code, Policy-As-Code and actually everything-as-code, as I believe that it helps humans, teams and organizations to operate fast and securely.

At work, I like automating as much as possible -following GitOps practices-, ensuring Supply Chain Security from CI/CD pipelines and IaC to Kubernetes clusters and Containers, and setting up observability tools and alerts. Outside of tech I enjoy hiking, literature, 3D printing, playing the guitar, and being part of Open Source communities - contributing anywhere I can.

name: Koray Oksay
bio: He works at Kubermatic as a Kubernetes Consultant and Trainer to help companies with their cloud-native journey. Before that, he worked for startup and enterprise companies in the advertising, banking, and telecom industries as SysAdmin, Application Admin, DevOps Engineer, and SRE for more than 20 years.

name: Kostiantyn Skraga
bio: I am an IT enthusiast, who is passionate about all the latest technologies. I love to mentor people, and share my knowledge. I do that through my blog and meetups. Happy to promote CNCF cutting-edge technologies, engage with a vibrant community, share my knowledge, network with industry professionals, and contribute to open-source projects.

name: Kostiantyn Zaihraiev
bio: I am a Senior DevOps Engineer with extensive experience across public cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, Microsoft Azure, and Aliyun. My journey with Kubernetes has been a game-changer, allowing me to integrate it into various solutions, empowering infrastructure with its flexibility and scalability. I’m also passionate about Blockchain and Distributed Computing systems, using Golang and Terraform to bring my ideas to life. Becoming a Kubestranaut has been an incredible achievement, giving me the opportunity to connect with professionals in the infrastructure engineering space and deepen my expertise.

name: Kounoshin Kojiyama
bio: I  work as a platform engineer at OPTAGE Inc.  I built a Kubernetes infrastructure within the company . And I aim to build an infrastructure that combines efficiency, scalability, and security, and to create a platform that is easy for developers to use. Definitely, I love and am enthusiastic about development that creates new value!

name: Krishna Kumar Uvanachandran
bio: Krishna Uvanachandran is a Lead DevOps Engineer with experience in designing, implementing, and managing robust infrastructure solutions for high-traffic web applications. He holds a Master's degree in Computer Science and has continuously pursued professional development through certifications such as Microsoft Certified DevOps Engineer and Kubernetes Administrator. As a DevOps Lead, Krishna excels in fostering a collaborative environment where cross-functional teams can thrive. He is known for his strategic vision in aligning DevOps practices with business objectives, driving innovation, and ensuring compliance with industry standards and best practices.

name: Kristina Devochko
bio:
Kristina Devochko is a platform engineer, tech content creator, speaker and tech community contributor based in Norway. She focuses on all things cloud native, Kubernetes, cloud security and green tech. Kristina is an owner of kristhecodingunicorn.com tech blog, a CNCF Ambassador, Microsoft Azure MVP, CNCF TAG Environmental Sustainability tech lead, Kubernetes Unpacked podcast host, co-organizer of multiple meetup groups and mentor. In her free time Kristina enjoys doing CTF challenges, reading and cuddling with her four cats.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I love giving back to the tech community and I hope that my actions and contributions can inspire others to create software with sustainability, security and cloud native principles in mind. Another important goal for me is to contribute to even stronger diversity, equality and inclusion in the cloud native space by creating a non-judgemental, open, safe and welcoming space for everyone. By being an ambassador I can focus even more on doing just that! I'm also very excited to meet all the fantastic ambassadors and members of the cloud native community and collaborate on making a positive impact in the CNCF space together :)

name: Krzysztof Dąbrowski
bio: I'm a DevOps Engineer who enjoys working with cloud-native technologies. I'm all about building and improving systems in the cloud, using containers, CI/CD and IaC. In my free time, I'm contributing to open-source projects and learning new technologies.

name: Kugamoorthy Gajananan
bio: Gajan, a Senior Consultant, excels at tackling intricate cloud migration, security, and compliance challenges for large enterprises. With over 7 years of experience, he specializes in researching, designing, building, and deploying cloud-native platforms and solutions, emphasizing security. Gajan has actively contributed to open-source cloud-native security projects, including Integrity Shield, Open Cluster Management/policy-collection, Kubernetes community-operators, and ArgoCD Interlace. His passion lies in assisting enterprises in adopting cloud-native practices and tools to enhance their agility, scalability, and resiliency.

name: Kunal Kushwaha
bio: Kunal Kushwaha is a Developer Relations Manager at Civo, where he fosters a deep connection between developers and innovative cloud-native technologies. With a passion for empowering others, Kunal has taught thousands online and consulted numerous companies on their DevOps journey. Recognized as a community leader, he has delivered keynote speeches at global conferences, embodying empathy in all aspects of his work and life.

name: Kunal Verma
bio: Kunal is a DevOps and Cloud Native Advocate with a passion for Open Source. He's been involved in the DevOps and open-source ecosystem for 2+ years now and has strong experience in public speaking, community management, content creation etc. He has experience working on and contributing to some of the major projects in the CNCF, including Kubernetes, Layer5 and others. He strives to empower others with his experiences and believes in growing with the community! These days, his focus lies in the field of DevOps, Cloud Native and Developer Relations.

name: Kunchala Vikram Babu
bio: As a Senior Technical Specialist at Sony India Software Centre, I leverage my expertise in DevOps, cloud technologies, Python, Go, and Linux to design, develop, and deliver cutting-edge cloud-native applications and solutions for Sony's diverse product portfolio. My proficiency in Kubernetes, Terraform, and other cloud platforms enables me to automate, orchestrate, and secure the deployment and management of containerized workloads across various environments. I am driven by a passion for continuous learning, problem-solving, and knowledge sharing. This dedication is reflected in my role at Sony and through my YouTube channel, DevOps Made Easy, where I share tutorials, tips, and best practices on a range of DevOps topics. With over 20,000 subscribers, my channel has become a valuable resource for the DevOps community, earning widespread positive feedback and engagement.

name: Kyeongjin Jeong
bio: Kyeongjin has transitioned from being a System Operator, System Administrator, and System Engineer to working as a Cloud Engineer, and is currently active as a DevOps engineer. Through experiences as a Cloud Engineer and DevOps Engineer, Kyeongjin developed an interest in cloud-native systems and Linux systems, which naturally led to a focus on Docker and Kubernetes. While Kyeongjin's blog is temporarily inactive, it will be back soon under a different URL. Currently, Kyeongjin is working as a DevOps Engineer at InfoGrab. Blog : https://velog.io/@ralook/posts

name: Kyungha Yu
bio: Hi I am Kyungha Yu, working as a SW Engineer at kt ds since 2023. I am very pleased to become a Kubestronaut, and the journey to becoming a Kubestronaut was truly meaningful. Because I have a strong interest in the Cloud Native Landscape, I would like to study other Cloud Native technologies such as Cilium and Chaos Engineering, also I want to learn about how Cloud Native can be integrated with AI. Finally, I hope to be able to contribute to Cloud Native open source projects in the near future.

name: Kürşad Güneş
bio: Kürşad GÜNEŞ is a Senior System Administrator with a strong interest in Cloud Technologies. He is passionate about cutting-edge technologies and instrumental in optimizing workflows, improving system reliability, and automating processes. He has extensive hands-on experience in cybersecurity and system management, with 15 years of experience in system, network, and application security. He is honored to be part of the Kubernetes community and to be a Kubestronaut.
company: Republic Of Turkey Ministry of Industry and Technology

name: Kārlis Akots Gribulis
bio: I am a Latvian container platform engineer with focus on building, maintaining and improving Kubernetes platforms and developer experience within them. Actively use and promote open source products within my workplaces. Have also made some minor open source contributions to products, such as, Grafana, Prometheus, etc.

name: Lachlan Evenson
bio: Lachlan is a Principal Program Manager on the open source team at Azure. As a cloud native ambassador, emeritus Kubernetes release lead, and Helm charts maintainer, Lachlan has deep operational knowledge of many Cloud Native projects. He spends his days building and contributing to software that addresses key challenges in the Cloud Native ecosystem.

name: Lakshmi Meghana Kakarla
bio: I started my career with GoLang and worked my way to Kubernetes. I have 5+ years of experience in Kubernetes. My last job is with Microsoft where I worked as an AKS Engineer. I am passionate about cloud technologies and love exploring CNCF tools.

name: Le Hoang Bach Le
bio: I studied mathematics and computer science and spend my free time working with new technologies. Professional development is very important to me. As of today, I have earned over 50 IT certificates in the areas of AWS, Azure, Kubernetes, Terraform, GitHub and Linux.

name: Leandro Bedin
bio: I’ve over twenty five years of experience in IT and Technology, especially within the Financial Services industry. I’m passionate about continual learning in order to drive efficiency and productivity and aim to inspire others to do likewise and develop their skills to achieve their goals. Always willing to investigate and explore the many technologies that exist within the DevSecOps world and Cloud Native space especially around automation, security and reliability...and of course Kubernetes :-)

name: Lee Calcote
bio:
Lee Calcote is the Founder of Layer5, where the community helps organizations harness and exploit the value of service meshes. Previously, Calcote stewarded technology strategy and innovation across SolarWinds. He led software-defined data center engineering at Seagate, delivering predictive analytics and modern systems management. Calcote held various leadership positions at Cisco, where he created Cisco’s cloud management platforms and pioneered new, automated, remote management services.

In addition to his role at Layer5, Calcote serves in various industry bodies, including as a SIG chair in Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), and formerly, participated in the delivery of Redfish 1.0 in the Distributed Management Task Foundation (DMTF), and Docker Benchmark 1.0 in Center for Internet Security (CIS). He is a startup advisor, Docker Captain, Cloud Native Ambassador, O’Reilly author, and speaker in the cloud native ecosystem.

Calcote is a maintainer of open source projects, including Meshery, Service Mesh Interface, and Service Mesh Performance. Calcote holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a master’s degree in Business Administration from California State University, Fresno and retains a list of industry certifications.

Meetup: Cloud Native Austin

name: Leo Paillier
bio: Strong Cloud architect with a passion for innovation and a focus on DevSecOps. I bring extensive experience in cloud technologies, particularly Kubernetes and Observability. Currently working as an Enterprise Sales Engineer at Datadog where I help customers on their Observability journey. My motto: Always keep learning.

name: Leon Nunes
bio:
I'm a technical support engineer, currently I mostly have varied interests ranging from Hardware to K8s and VM's Blogs I've written are at https://dev.to/mediocreDevops

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: This is a quite new thing to me so I'm taking it all in, hoping I can get some guidance on how this whole thing works, but I'm excited to be a part of this and give back to the community

name: Leonard Pahlke
bio:
Hey, my name is Leonard Pahlke, and I am a software engineer with a focus on cloud, open source and sustainability. I like to build systems that tend to get big and complex. I post regularly on the CNCF blog and my own website lvsp.io. I am a CNCF Ambassador, Chair for the CNCF TAG Environmental Sustainability, lead the Kubernetes release team for v1.26 and organize meetups in Hamburg.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I love the cloud and the infinite variety and complexity of systems that can be built on it. The CNCF truly makes cloud-native applications accessible to anyone and any platform. The open source spirit fascinates and inspires me. Serving as a ambassador the community is a great honor.

name: Leonid Kopylov
bio: I am a technology enthusiast and AWS professional, holding all certifications in the field. I thrive on learning new things and am currently passionate about mastering Kubernetes. Outside of work, I enjoy exploring the latest tech trends.

name: Li Yi
bio: Li Yi (Mark), is the Director of Engineering for Container Service at Alibaba Cloud. Mark leads the product development and technical strategy for the container product portfolio at Alibaba Cloud. His team contributes to a variety of Open Source communities in CNCF such as Kubernetes, containerd, Dragonfly, Argo, and more. Previously Mark worked at IBM for 14 years as Senior Technical Staff Member in cloud computing and middleware areas.

name: Hengyue Li
bio: A DevOps and application operation engineer, responsible for hybrid cloud system architecture maintenance and evolution planning. I have been involved in the cloud native field since 2021, and currently focus on improving the stability of cloud environment infrastructure and application stability. Participate in the operation and maintenance of core systems such as container platform orchestration and scheduling, and have experience in multiple practical projects. I usually like to study open source projects, am passionate about new technologies, and practice the concept of cloud native.

name: Liam Randall
bio:
As the CEO of Cosmonic and co-creator of CNCF wasmCloud, Liam has significantly advanced cloud-native computing. His started his journey in the CNCF early, creating the first commercial Kubernetes distribution, Critical Stack, in 2014 (acquired by Capital One Bank in 2016). At Capital One, Liam helped migrate the first regulated company into the cloud, led the donation of Cloud Custodian into the CNCF, and co-founded CNCF wasmDay, firmly establishing himself as a leading figure in promoting WebAssembly in cloud-native environments.

Why am I excited to be a CNCF Ambassador?

I'm deeply passionate about the transformative power of open source and diverse collaborative communities - they really are better together. To me, these are not just technical methodologies to describe features of code creation but pathways to building superior software. My commitment to this belief is rooted in years of experience and observation; open communities foster innovation, collaboration, and a level of quality that proprietary models struggle to match. Particularly with WebAssembly's emergence in the cloud-native space, I've witnessed how it empowers developers to create more efficient, secure, and versatile applications, further fueling my enthusiasm as a CNCF Ambassador to advocate for these technologies.

name: Libby Schulze
bio: Libby is a Marketing Programs Manager at CNCF overseeing Online Programs, KubeWeekly, and other marketing initiatives. Her experience spans over 15 years in the tech industry including event planning and marketing. She holds a Bachelor of Science from the University of Texas and currently resides in San Antonio. When not at work, Libby enjoys spending time with her family and going to the beach.

name: Liman Alhassan
bio: I'm a DevOps enthusiast with a passion for automation in infrastructure and application deployment. My areas of expertise include Kubernetes, Helm, Argo, KEDA, Falco, and Ansible, where I focus on streamlining operations and enhancing deployment strategies. I actively participate in DevOps discussions and share insights on these technologies.

name: Lin Sun
bio: Lin is the Head of Open Source at Solo.io, also serving as a CNCF TOC member and ambassador. She has been actively involved with the Istio service mesh since its inception in 2017, holding positions on both the Istio Steering Committee and Technical Oversight Committee. Prior to her current role, she was a Senior Technical Staff Member and Master Inventor at IBM for 15+ years. She is the author of the book "Istio Ambient Explained" and has more than 200 patents to her name.

name: Lindsay Gendreau
bio: Lindsay works collaboratively with the CNCF community to support, manage and execute events that build capacity within the ecosystem. Lindsay has 20+ years of experience in executing, leading, and designing global event experiences in corporate, nonprofit, and educational settings.  Within that time, Lindsay supported The Linux Foundation events team for 3 years working on Open Sources Summits, Embedded Linux Conferences, Leadership Summits, etc. She holds a Bachelor of Science in Event & Hospitality Management from the University of Central Florida.

name: Linus Östberg
bio: I am a life science researcher and bioinformatician turned platform engineer. I am currently working as a Kubernetes consultant with a special focus on security. I use Rancher, Neuvector, Cilium, and multiple other technologies.

name: Lionel LONKAP TSAMBA
bio: I'm a Founder/CEO, Speaker, Investor and DevOps & Cloud Architect with more than a decade of experience working in the IT industry. I'm a pragmatic polyglot software engineer who's passionate about technologies, innovations, and helping others grow either their carrier or their business.

name: Lisa-Marie Namphy
bio:
Lisa is a developer advocate and community architect, and is Head of Developer Relations at Intuit (home of Argo Proj). Lisa is also a CNCF Ambassador and Silicon Valley Cloud Native User Group organizer (with over 7000 members). Lisa is an advocate and frequent speaker for open source technology and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion initiatives, a writer, an avid sports fan, and loves wine and dogs. Follow Lisa on Twitter @SWDevAngel and LinkedIn @lnamphy.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: It has been a great pleasure to be a CNCF Ambassador for the past several years and I am thrilled to continue the journey. I love working with this particular group of colleagues to evangelize open source and cloud native technology, to mentor new community members, to give a platform and a voice and to encourage participation in ALL areas of the cloud native ecosystem. And to have the support of the CNCF to extend the reach of cloud native technology to "the last mile" has been an extremely rewarding experience that I am grateful and excited to continue! :) Looking so much forward to working with all of you in the coming years! :)

name: Liz Rice
bio: Liz is Chief Open Source Officer with eBPF specialists Isovalent, creators of the Cilium cloud native networking, security and observability project. She is on the Board of OpenUK, and was Chair of the CNCF's Technical Oversight Committee in 2019-2022, and Co-Chair of KubeCon + CloudNativeCon in 2018. She is also the author of Container Security, published by O'Reilly.

name: Loc Mai
bio: Like many others here, I'm a tech enthusiast with a strong passion for cloud infrastructure, scalable and distributed systems, and Kubernetes. When I'm not immersed in tech, I enjoy playing video games. When I decide to step away from the screen and touch some grass, I travel to explore other cultures (through their food)!

name: Long Li
bio: I am an SRE. I began exploring cloud-native technologies in 2022 and successfully obtained CKA and CKS certifications. I have developed a strong passion for cloud-native technologies and am currently focusing on cloud-native DevOps practices.

name: Loo Chee Heong
bio: Cloud Native/DevOps Enthusiast. Experience in ML and data engineering

name: Lori Lorusso
bio: Lori has a passion and enthusiasm for working with the developer and open source community. She is a CNCF Ambassador, former CNCF Marketing Committee Chair, former Chair of the CDF Outreach Marketing Committee, program chair of cdCon 2023, and is active in the OpenSSF devrel committee. She co-hosts the CD Pipeline on behalf of the CDF with TechstrongTV. She is committed to helping open source and other tech communities grow and adapt in our ever changing environment. She is currently Head of Community for Percona.

name: Luca Banzato
bio: IT Consultant with strong advocation to DevOps technologies and best practices, focusing on automation and everything which goes around. I started as a regular GNU/Linux administrator and then discovered things were made easier lately, thus I performed a relatively painless switch due to my previous background experience. My knowledge spaces from regular programming skills and troubleshooting, automation with Ansible/Terraform/Saltstack to everything involving Kubernetes and OpenShift clusters administration, passing by CI/CD pipelines scripting and management, while including observability here and there. For me learning is something like a drug: you cannot stop once you start. I mainly attend conventions and local events in North Italy to meet other experts, share ideas and trying to innovate the view each one of us has regarding a subject.

name: Luca Cavallin
bio: Senior Software Engineer at GitHub Actions, passionate about developer and infrastructure tools, distributed systems, systems- and network-programming, sharing knowledge. My expertise primarily revolves around Go, Kubernetes, serverless architectures and the Cloud Native domain in general. Off-hours: photography, cycling, kamados, cats.

name: Luis Miguel Copa Diaz
bio: I am Luis Miguel Copa Diaz, a dedicated DevOps professional with a strong passion for cloud-native technologies, open source, and security tools. Since 2018, I have been actively working with tools like Kubernetes, Docker, and various security solutions, and I regularly host meetings on integrating AI with cloud technologies to drive innovation. With extensive experience in AWS and Azure, and strong scripting skills in Python, Bash, and PowerShell and GitOps tools, I focus on leveraging cloud solutions to enhance efficiency and scalability. I hold numerous certifications, reflecting my commitment to continuous learning and professional growth. Enthusiastic about data science and security, I actively engage in community discussions and contribute to the advancement of cloud-native practices.
location: Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia

name: Lukasz Gryglicki
bio:
Lukasz has been a Senior Developer at the CNCF since 2017 and has been working for The Linux Foundation since 2018. He is the creator and maintainer of the DevStats reporting tool. Prior to joining the CNCF, Lukasz worked remotely for companies based in the US, including Cleverstep, Jamis and Spreemo Health.

He loves to travel in polar areas, such as polar Norway, Finland and Russia. From 2011 to 2012, he was a scientist for a Polish polar expedition to the Hornsund fjord on the island of Spitsbergen, in northern Norway. Lukasz graduated from Warsaw University of Technology with a Master of Science in Engineering. He lives in a small town in Poland with his wife and two kids.

name: Maciej Szytów
bio: DevOps Engineer

name: Madhu S Mallisetty
bio: Madhu Mallisetty is an exceptional Technology Solutions Architect with extraordinary expertise in MuleSoft integration and cloud-native technologies, particularly Kubernetes. As a certified Kubernetes Administrator and a Salesforce certified MuleSoft Integration Architect, Mallisetty possesses a rare combination of skills that places him at the forefront of digital transformation. His architectural designs have resulted in significant improvements, including a 30% increase in operational efficiency for major enterprises, demonstrating his ability to deliver high-impact solutions. Mallisetty's unique ability to seamlessly integrate legacy systems with cutting-edge cloud technologies enables businesses to achieve unprecedented levels of scalability and innovation. His continued contributions, including mentoring and thought leadership, are shaping the future of enterprise integration and cloud-native technologies across industries.

name: Mads Høgstedt Danquah
bio: Mads is a father of three girls, lifelong scout, and passionate volunteer, He is a firm believer in changing the world by helping and supporting others to be their best. He has always been interested in how technology works and how people interact with it. Mads is a strong advocate for open communities and the power of open source to level the playing field for the next generation. His current focus is on platform engineering, with an emphasis on building products that enable the rest of the organization. In his spare time, he volunteers with the Danish Scout Association and helps organize Kubernetes Community Days in Denmark.

name: Mahamed Ali
bio: I'm a Senior DevOps Engineer at ThousandEyes by Cisco and a maintainer of Kubernetes and Knative. I'm working on improving the cloud infrastructure of the Kubernetes project for our contributors and end-users. I'm also a member of the Kubestronaut program.

name: MAHESH DATTA SHINDE
bio: Experienced DevOps Engineer with over 14+ years of hands-on experience in Linux Systems Administration, Docker, Kubernetes, and setting up robust CI/CD pipelines. Skilled in scripting deployment activities, automating cloud infrastructure configurations, and ensuring efficient cloud operations. Proficient in Kubernetes, AWS Cloud Services, Terraform, Jenkins CI/CD, and Chef. Holds certifications in Kubernetes, AWS Cloud, Terraform, and Jenkins, showcasing expertise in cloud architecture and automation. Demonstrated ability to implement and maintain secure and compliant infrastructure. Well-versed in Agile (SAFe) and Scrum methodologies, emphasizing collaboration and efficiency. Additional knowledge in Couchbase, ELK stack, Grafana, and Prometheus for comprehensive monitoring and logging.

name: Majid Faridi
bio: Majid Faridi is a Senior DevOps Engineer with over 8 years of experience, specializing in Kubernetes, cloud-native technologies, and CNCF ecosystems. He shares his expertise through technical blog posts and is passionate about optimizing infrastructure while staying engaged with the latest developments in the cloud-native space.

name: Maksym Kursin
bio: Hello. I'm Maksym Kursin, a Staff Cloud Engineer at DKATALIS, which is backing the leading Indonesian digital bank, Jago. I specialize in delivering cloud-native solutions that meet the rigorous demands of the FSI sector. GCP advocate.

name: Maksym Petrychenko
bio: I am a professional Cloud Architect and DevOps Team Lead in our company, specializing in designing and implementing solutions on top of Kubernetes. My expertise includes automating infrastructure, optimizing CI/CD pipelines, and enhancing application scalability and resilience.

name: Manaswi Mandadapu
bio: Leveraging DevOps, AI strategies & Cloud technology to improve outcomes in modern application development and operations.

name: Mangesh Pachkale
bio: A result-driven IT professional with expertise in Server infrastructure, Virtualization, Cloud Computing, DevOps, Load Balancing, Kubernetes enthusiast, practitioner and Opensource adopter/advocate. A key member of Platform Engineering team who plans, designs, implements, manages and troubleshoots enterprise wide mission critical technologies. I bring an innovative and pragmatic approach to analyzing complex business needs, enabling me to conceptualize, design and implement cutting edge solutions based on the latest technologies, in-depth knowledge, R&D mindset. I am passionate about learning & implementing new technologies, and believes in learn & change, also enjoy meeting like-minded people.

name: Manuel Vogel
bio: Hi, I'm Manuel, a Freelance AWS Solution Architect & DevOps engineer by heart with a broad set of skills strong collaboration and knowledge-sharing abilities. My aim is to minimize your risks by setting standards on software architecture and quality, deployment strategies, pipelines, and automation. I run the AWS User Group Frankfurt as a co-leader.

name: Marc Merzinger
bio: Cloud architect and builder of container platforms based on Kubernetes. Loves to automate things with Argocd, Helm or CI/CD pipelines. Co-organizer of the Cloud Native Meetup Bern and Swiss Cloud Native Day.

name: Marc ter Bogt
bio: My interest in technology and automation helped me to become a Linux and cloud platform engineer. By following this path I have been able to satisfy my technical curiosity and contribute to various automation related roles and projects. Solving problems through code come natural to me and I enjoy translating requests and problems into an automated solution.

name: Marc Vázquez
bio: Coming from SRE background, now working as technical lead and solutions architect. I'm a technology passionate and i'm always ready to learn. I've a strong aws background and during the last years I’ve acquired solid skills in designing and setting up cloud-native architectures and technologies. As a Solutions architect I advocate for Container and Cloud Native solutions, automation and gitops.

name: Marco Bulgarini
bio:
As a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer, I take great pride in managing complex systems at scale, treating them with the precision and care they deserve.

My passion for Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and GitOps drove me to Kubernetes and continues to push me on a path for more self-organizing, self-healing, self-scaling systems. Whether it's optimizing a Cloud Infrastructure with Terraform, fine-tuning a datastore or message broker, or instrumenting applications for maximum observability, I enjoy the challenge of making everything run smoothly.

name: Marco van Kimmenaede
bio: I'm Marco van Kimmenaede living with my wife and daughter in Hippolytushoef. Almost 25 years experience in IT infrastructure/Linux and last year’s mostly my focus on Kubernetes and the CloudNative landscape.

name: Marcos Paulo Riquetta
bio: With many years of experience as an IT Engineer, I am passionate about cloud infrastructure, cybersecurity, and Kubernetes. I hold multiple certifications in these domains, including all five Kubernetes. I also contribute to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) as a chapter organizer and a Kubernetes expert for the Cloud Native Calgary community group. My mission is to help organizations adopt and secure cloud-native technologies and practices.

name: Marcus Noble
bio:
Marcus is a platform engineer and his main area of focus in recent years has been around CI/CD, Go, Kubernetes, containers and DevOps but originally started out as a web developer and JavaScript enthusiast. A self-described “tinkerer”, when not building Kubernetes solutions, Marcus likes to dabble with 3D printing and experimenting with smart home tech. He can be found blogging online at www.MarcusNoble.co.uk and giving talks at meetups & conferences.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to leverage the support of the CNCF to better help others within out community through shared knowledge and experience. I'm excited for the opportunity to meet more amazing people in the cloud native space and learn from their experiences and expertise.

name: Marcus Notø
bio: Marcus Notø is a platform engineer specializing in Kubernetes, OpenShift, and cloud-native operations, with a focus on cost management, uptime, and security.

name: Marcus Ross
bio: In the past ten years, I have been addicted to the cloud (AWS/Azure/OpenTofu) and Kubernetes, helping enterprise customers to achieve their solutions. Always try to align business requirements with technology. I share my real-world experience from projects as an official Linuxfoudnation Kubernetes Trainer, AWS ChampionTrainer, and MCT.

name: Maria Salcedo
bio: Backend / DevOps developer with experience in cloud native Kubernetes deployments. I am passionate about GitOps and infrastructure as code.

name: Marino Wijay
bio: Marino Wijay is a Canadian, Traveller, International Speaker, Open Source Advocate for Service Mesh, CNI, Kubernetes, and Networking. He is an Ambassador @ Civo Cloud, and Lead Organizer for KubeHuddle Toronto. He is passionate about technology and modern distributed systems. He will always fall back to the patterns of Networking and the ways of the OSI. Community building is his driving force; A modern Jedi Academy.

name: Marit Nodland Lund
bio: Senior infrastructure engineer and cloud enthusiast. Excited to work more with the CNCF ecosystem and participate in the community.

name: Marius Matonis
bio: Marius Matonis specializes in cloud-native and multi-cloud solutions, platform engineering, DevSecOps, and cybersecurity. He excels in developing and securing cloud infrastructures, helping organizations implement scalable and secure technology strategies. Marius is passionate about mentoring and inspiring future tech leaders, fostering a collaborative learning environment, and sharing his expertise through professional meetups. His dedication to technological excellence and innovation ensures robust and reliable cloud solutions.

name: Marius Reinhardt
bio: Before a few years, as I started with containers, I was fascinated by the technology moving big things into tiny efficient container. Then I learned of kubernetes and couldn't hold back. Until now I try to secure kubernetes clusters and help other people with the open source stacks. Open source tools like falco, trivy or OPA should be simpler usable by everyone and everywhere to secure kubernetes cluster security.

name: Mark Højer Hansen
bio: IT Security Engineer with a passion for cloud and containerization technologies. Currently with a main focus of security, but love to learn about all the different technologies in the CNCF Landscape and all the concepts surrounding it.

name: Mark Wilson
bio: Mark is a DevOps Engineer working in FinTech in Melbourne, where he plays a co-organiser role at K8SUG - Australia's largest Kubernetes user group. With a background in software development spanning over 6+ years, Mark combines professional expertise with a lifelong passion for IT.

name: Marnik Van Hileghem
bio: Freelance Azure cloud engineer & architect with special interest in cloud-native technologies and applications. You can reach me on LinkedIn

name: Marquis Grove
bio: I'm a passionate software developer who thrives on tackling complex challenges. I love learning new technologies and continuously seek innovative solutions to improve systems and processes. Dedicated and detail-oriented, I leverage technical expertise to make an impact on every project.

name: Martin Weber
bio: As a Technical Lead and Platform Architect at Axel Springer National Media & Tech GmbH & Co. KG, I am responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining cloud-native platforms and solutions for the media and tech division of the leading European digital publisher. With over 15 years of experience in software engineering, DevOps, and cloud computing, I have acquired multiple CNCF certifications and extensive skills in AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform, among other technologies. I am passionate about delivering high-quality and reliable solutions that enable the digital transformation and innovation of Axel Springer and its brands. I am also committed to sharing my knowledge and expertise with my colleagues and the wider community, as well as learning from others and embracing new challenges. I am looking for opportunities to collaborate with diverse and talented teams and to contribute to the mission and vision of Axel Springer.
company: Axel Springer National Media and Tech GmbH & Co. KG

name: Martin Zieroth
bio: I'm working with Kubernetes since 5 or 6 years, at the beginning only in try and error mode. Today i'm responsible in one project for my own K8s clusters and in my other role i'm the product owner of our european central cloud clab where we are validating vendor workloads with our cloud and develop fluxcd deployments for it. I learned so much the last years at the Kubecons and met so many fantastic people. I'm really happy to choosed this way.

name: Mario Constanti
bio:
Mario is a Software Engineer at Mercedes-Benz Tech Innovation. In 2015 he jumped into the very young Kubernetes ecosystem and helped application teams to learn all the stuff around containers and K8s.

When Mercedes Benz decided in 2016 to launch a managed Kubernetes service, Mario was one of the initial members in that team in the very early beginning. That managed service evolved to a worldwide distributed platform within MB with nearly 1,000 dedicated clusters.

Over time, he has witnessed the evolution of Kubernetes and the CNCF as well as the adoption of cloud native patterns in software teams all over the world. He always wore different hats to make the product and the team a success. But at heart, he is still an engineer who loves to code.

name: Martina Clemente
bio: Declarative scripting enthusiast. Everything that can be versioned, should be versioned! I started as a Python Backend developer and then I slowly got curious about the Cloud and automation world until I decided to become a DevOps. The tools I had the most fun working with are Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform, mainly in the GCP cloud provider.

name: Masahiro Oke
bio: I work as an IT infrastructure engineer. I have been involved in the design, development, and operation of IaaS and STaaS in private cloud environments. Personally, I am interested in IT infrastructure using Kubernetes and have been testing OSS related to it. Recently, I have been designing and testing Kubernetes platforms for generative AI. My areas of interest include Kubernetes, hypervisors, IaC, edge computing, and networking.

name: Mathijs Hoogland
bio: I'm a freelance DevOps engineer with a specialisation in Kubernetes and cloud native environments. I love helping companies transform technically and culturally to fully grasp the advantages of Kubernetes. Usually the tech is easy, it's about people.

name: Matthew Robinson
bio: Matt has been doing DevOps since the mid-90's and for more than twenty years has been working in the higher education sector, ensuring students and researchers have access to the resources they need. Matt was introduced to containers almost a decade ago and a cloud migration project in 2000 allowed a move to Kubernetes. Kubernetes allowed a complex migration to be completed quickly and painlessly. As new challenges need solving, he often finds the solution exists in another CNCF project (Argo, Helm, Prometheus, OPA etc). Matt is excited about the future of cloud native and the future of CNCF projects.

name: Matthias Hauber
bio: Matthias Hauber is a DevOps and Cloud Engineer at PRODYNA. As part of the Managed Services team, he is responsible for the seamless operation of a large number of Kubernetes clusters and Azure environments for various customers. As a trainer for Kubernetes, Terraform and Azure, he has already been able to share his knowledge in numerous workshops.

name: Mauritz Uphoff
bio: Cloud Solution Architect who is fascinated by the beauty of Kubernetes

name: Maxim Skakun
bio: I am a Senior IT Consultant specializing in cloud infrastructure, with a focus on Google Cloud Platform, Infrastructure as Code, and Kubernetes. My role involves designing and implementing scalable cloud solutions that enhance operational efficiency and enable innovation at scale. I am passionate about leveraging the power of cloud technology to solve complex challenges and drive business growth.

name: Maximilian Marschall
bio: Enthusiastically immersed in the ever-evolving world of technology, Maximilian finds joy in pushing boundaries and continually venturing into uncharted territories. His current focus centers around Kubernetes and the realm of automation, with a particular penchant for harnessing the power of VMware Tanzu and ArgoCD to streamline and optimize processes. In the fascinating journey of technology exploration, his homelab has flourished, expanding to a scale that rivals the capabilities of some enterprise-level cloud infrastructures.

name: Maximilian Matthies
bio: Computer Science Expert - Subject Area: System Integration (IHK), Trainer for Kubernetes@Cloudogu, System Engineer @ SVA GmbH

name: Maximilien De csiky
bio: Systems engineer with almost 15 years of experience, I am passionate about DevOps, Kubernetes and everything related to Linux. My background has allowed me to manage technical projects and take on roles of responsibility, while keeping a real focus on customer satisfaction. Accustomed to working in a team and proposing innovative solutions, I enjoy both technology and relationships. My goal? Offer efficient, long-lasting solutions that make users' daily lives easier.

name: Mayo Takanashi
bio: Kubernetes Member, CNCF Security TAG Member. Cloud Native Community Special Author. Author of Implementing chaos engineering in K8s: chaos mesh principle analysis and control plane development on the CNCF official blog (https://www.cncf.io/blog/2022/01/13/implementing-chaos-engineering-in-k8s-chaos-mesh-principle-analysis-and-control-plane-development/). OSS active contributor.

name: Mayur Tendulkar
bio: Techno functional passionate person with love for technology and people. Mayur has been volunteering for Pune User Group since 2003 and has been Microsoft MVP for couple of years, till he joined Microsoft. More details here: https://bio.link/mayten

name: Md Nasir Uddin

I co-organize Kubernetes Community Days in Dhaka and Chattogram, with expertise in CNCF technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, Terraform, cloud technologies, and CI/CD tools.

name: Md. Mokit Hossain

My experience spans across health care, education, and travel-related platforms, where I've honed my skills in Kubernetes and other CNCF technologies. In my workplace, I’m always sharing insights and best practices of CNCF technologies with fellow enthusiasts.

name: Mehmet Yazıcıoğlu
bio: I started my career as a Software Engineer and transitioned into DevOps, later expanding into DevSecOps, and I am now working as a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE). With a strong foundation in software development, I specialize in Kubernetes and CNCF technologies. My focus is on integrating GitOps principles to enhance, automate, and secure operations, helping organizations streamline their DevOps and DevSecOps processes while optimizing infrastructure for improved efficiency, security, and reliability.

name: Mehrdad Faridi
bio: Mehrdad Faridi is an accomplished Senior DevOps/SRE Engineer with over 8 years of experience in automation and cloud computing across platforms like AWS, GCP, and OpenStack. A Kubestronaut with expertise in Kubernetes, he specializes in managing resilient, cloud-native infrastructure. Mehrdad leverages CNCF tools such as ArgoCD, Prometheus, and Grafana to build scalable and efficient solutions. Known for his ability to streamline software development pipelines, he drives innovation in operational processes. His proven track record ensures high-quality outcomes in complex environments.

name: Meletis Papadopoulos

name: Melvin Wee
bio: I’m a security specialist at Resorts World Sentosa, where I focus on safeguarding our world-class facilities and ensuring a secure environment for guests and staff. My role involves integrating security measures with our operations, tackling potential threats, and maintaining a seamless, safe experience for everyone.

name: Merijn Keppel
bio: An experienced and passionate techie with deep expertise in Kubernetes, networking, and hosting. Spare time contributor to open-source projects and is engaged in the CNCF community. With a strong analytical mindset, I'm able to solve complex challenges and drive innovation.

name: Michael Hill
bio: Michael Hill is a technologist and executive with a decade of experience designing and building complex systems, programs, and teams. He is an avid open-source evangelist and active member of the cloud native community. Michael is currently helping build a sustainable future by building bleeding edge grid solutions as VP of Technical Operations (TechOps) and Cybersecurity at Kitu Systems, Inc.

name: Michael Klug
bio: I am a Senior DevOps Engineer with a background in Software Engineering, bringing years of experience in managing complex systems. I started my career as a Linux System Administrator, which laid the foundation for my deep understanding of infrastructure and operations. Currently, I help host the CNCF chapter in Graz, sharing my passion for cloud-native technologies with the community. I have a strong interest in Infrastructure as Code and GitOps, and I actively leverage these practices to create efficient, scalable, and automated solutions. My focus lies in empowering developers by simplifying their workflows and making their lives easier.

name: Michał Bajer
bio: Associated with the IT industry for many years. I like the work I do and I like to develop myself in it. I constantly set new goals for myself and consistently strive to achieve them.

name: Michał Nyga
bio: Michał is a DevOps Engineer, specializing in internal development platforms based on Kubernetes clusters. In addition, he shares his knowledge with others, guided by the motto - ”be the senior you needed when you were a junior”.

name: Micheal Choudhary
bio: Micheal here, a DevOps professional with over a decade of experience in the tech landscape. I've crafted code, architected and managed infrastructures, and thrived on challenges and continuous learning. I'm passionate about code, optimized infrastructure, and automation. Currently, I'm engaged in DevOps, orchestrating systems and using cloud technologies. This ever-changing field pushes me to keep learning and growing as a DevOps professional.

name: Miguel Angel Vila Huallpa
bio: Graduated in Network Administration, due to unusual circumstances, I ended up working as a developer and sysadmin. Since 2019, I have been working with container technologies. I enjoy automating processes with various tools and configuring monitoring of various platforms and applications.

name: Mike Smith
bio: Results-oriented DevOps Engineer with a strong foundation in automation and GitOps. Possessing a relentless drive for continuous improvement and a disciplined approach to problem-solving, I excel at building and maintaining reliable, scalable systems. Proven ability to lead and mentor teams while delivering impactful results. In my free time, I write at https://smig.tech

name: Min Khant Zaw
bio: Open Source Enthusiast and experienced Linux System Administrator specialized in open-source technologies, dedicated to delivering efficient and secure services to the finance and telecom sectors. Focusing on architecting resilient microservices across multiple cloud providers using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and leveraging CNCF's open-source technologies.

name: Mingqing Li
bio: I have over ten years of experience in operations and maintenance, focusing on cloud computing, microservice architecture, and automation, with a particular emphasis on cloud-native technology. I am skilled at transforming complex business requirements into efficient and reliable architectures, using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to ensure system scalability and high availability. In my spare time, I contribute to open-source projects by adding features and fixing bugs. I also maintain my own development toolkit, https://grpc-kit.com, to simplify project development and delivery. I am committed to continuous learning and innovation to stay at the cutting edge of technology and create value for teams and enterprises.

name: Mitja Škufca
bio: Consulting Engineer at NIL Ltd, Kubernetes fan and musician.

name: Mohamed Anouar Khediri
bio: Mohamed Anouar is a passionate DevOps engineer and Cloud Native Technologies guru. He has an engineering degree in Telecommunications and certified in Kubernetes, Openshift and Terraform. He is committed to continuous learning and self-improvement to drive exceptional results. He has a proven track record of successful projects with many clients around the globe to adopt open source solutions and adopt cloud native application development best practices.

name: Mohamed Oun
bio: I am Mohamed Oun, an engineering student at ESPRIT specializing in cloud computing. I hold several professional certifications, including Red Hat System Administrator, Kubernetes Administrator, AWS Cloud Foundation, and Terraform Associate. I am proud to be recognized as a 'Kubestronaut,' being the second person in Tunisia to earn this distinction. I am also preparing for an exchange semester at IMT Atlantique in France to further enhance my expertise.

name: Mohammad Qaderi
bio: I'm a seasoned DevOps engineer specializing in cloud solutions and Kubernetes. With extensive experience as a software engineer, I honed a robust skill set in automating and optimizing software delivery processes. Their expertise in cloud infrastructure and container orchestration has been instrumental in driving efficiency and scalability for various organizations. I passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technologies to solve complex challenges and improve operational workflows.

name: Mohammed Roshdy
bio: A Software Engineer with experience and a strong interest in backend development and DevOps, who loves learning and exploring new technologies.

name: Mohsen Mahdavifar
bio: I still have a lot to learn and decode. However, I am a DevOps/Cloud Platform Consultant and Engineer with over 18 years of IT experience. I have trained over 1,200 students and led various impactful projects. My expertise includes DevOps tools and stacks, Linux, Kubernetes, Container Orchestration Tools and Platforms, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), automation, CI/CD, Cloud Technologies, Performance Tuning, System Hardening, and Clustering. I am passionate about Linux, open-source technologies, and CNCF projects. I enjoy automating and codifying processes with various tools and thrive on tackling tech challenges. Constantly learning and innovating, I embrace every opportunity to grow in this dynamic field.

name: Mojtaba Imani
bio: Platform Consultant at Xebia, Founder of Kuberise.io , specialist in internal developer platforms and developer productivity, writer, speaker, providing training and workshops about kubernetes and platform engineering

name: Muhammad Khan
bio: I am a Solutions Engineer with over 15 years of expertise in the IT industry, specializing in cloud platforms like AWS and GCP, as well as Kubernetes. I work with customers to navigate complex use cases and overcome technical challenges, delivering tailored solutions in application modernization, DevOps, and cloud architecture. My strengths lie in optimizing workloads and aligning cloud strategies with business objectives to drive innovation and operational efficiency.

name: Muntashir Islam
bio: With over six years of experience as a Site Reliability and DevOps Engineer, I have been extensively working with high-available Kubernetes clusters in production environments, integrating various CNCF projects, including service mesh. My expertise lies in designing and managing scalable, highly available cloud infrastructure on AWS and Azure. I have a proven track record of building robust, automated systems from the ground up, focusing on efficiency, security, and reliability.

name: Mustafa Fidan
bio: With a deep expertise in CNCF tools like Kubernetes, Helm etc., I attend local Meetups to connect cloud-native enthusiasts and discuss emerging trends in microservices and infrastructure automation.

name: Mélony Qin
bio: I'm passionate about open-source and cloud-native technologies, particularly Kubernetes and serverless, and their intersection with Data & AI workloads. I authored multiple books about Kubernetes over the years with the intention to help learners skill up on Kubernetes and find a new career path. I'm proud and excited to be a CNCF ambassador! Being an ambassador allows me to connect more with the community. I would love to share knowledge and learn, and I hope to help others learn about cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes and how Kubernetes serves as the backbone in the age of AI. I will continue to create engaging educational content to help people navigate the complexities of Kubernetes adoption more effectively. I am sharing tech educational content on my YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@CloudMelonVis and on my blog: https://cvisiona.com. And last but not least my favorite Github : https://github.com/cloudmelon, I'm happy to connect!

name: Michael Hajjar
bio: I am a freelance Linux, Kubernetes and Security engineer. Owner of CloudyLinux. Love working on complex problems to create and combine innovative solutions in the CNCF-ecosystem.

name: Michael Schulz
bio: Started at Dell Technologies in Client Tech Support. Now working as a Service Reliability Engineer wich a passion for the CNCF landscape and kubernetes.

name: Michał Matuszak
bio: DevOps Engineer experienced in provisioning and maintaining an IT infrastructure as well as automation of software development and deployment processes. Passionate about kubernetes, ArgoCD and many other CNCF technologies. GitOps advocate.

name: Michel Murabito
bio: I'm Michel Murabito, but everyone calls me Mich. I'm a Developer Advocate at Mia-Platform with over 18 years of experience in software development.
