My current focus is on utilizing Kubernetes to optimize the execution of AI/ML workloads. I'm an active member of the tech community, co-organizing the DC Kubernetes Meetup and sharing my insights on open-source technologies.

name: Rey Lejano
bio:
Rey Lejano is Solutions Architect at Red Hat and currently serves as co-chair for Kubernetes Special Interest Group (SIG) Docs and helps maintain the upstream Kubernetes documentation. Rey leads the Kubernetes SIG Security Third-Party Security Audit subproject and helped release the last Kubernetes security audit in April 2023. He is a member of seven Kubernetes Release Teams, including serving as the 1.23 Release Lead and 1.25 Emeritus Adviser. Rey was awarded the CNCF Community Award for Top Documentarian in 2022 and Kubernetes Contributor Awards in 2021 from SIG Release and 2023 from SIG Security. He is working on KCD San Francisco Bay Area and cloudnativeessentials.com to help the people to start on their cloud native journey.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Community propels open source projects to flourish. I'm excited to be an ambassador to help grow the cloud native community by providing mentorship to new contributors, guidance to those starting on their cloud native journey, and amplifying the excitement for cloud native technology.

name: Rhegisan Jebas
bio: As a seasoned DevOps engineer, I specialize in leveraging automation and cutting-edge tools to streamline processes and enhance efficiency. Off-duty, I'm deeply immersed in cricket and e-gaming, where strategy and precision captivate me just as they do in my professional endeavors. Engaging with cloud communities and conferences keeps me informed on the latest tech trends, enabling me to optimize workflows and share insights effectively.

name: Ricardo Rocha
bio: Ricardo leads the Platform Infrastructure team at CERN with a strong focus on cloud native deployments and machine learning. He has led for several years the internal effort to transition services and workloads to use cloud native technologies, as well as dissemination and training efforts. Ricardo got CERN to join the CNCF and is a lead of the CNCF Research User Group. Prior to this work Ricardo helped develop the grid computing infrastructure serving the Large Hadron Collider (LHC).

name: Richard Hartmann
bio: Richard "RichiH" Hartmann is the Director of Community at Grafana Labs, Prometheus team member, OpenMetrics founder, OpenTelemetry member, CNCF TAG Observability chair, CNCF Governing Board member, and more. He also leads or organizes various conferences, including PromCon, FOSDEM, DENOG, DebConf, and Chaos Communication Congress. In the past, he made mainframe databases work, ISP backbones run, freenode work, and designed and built a datacenter from scratch. Go through his talks at https://github.com/RichiH/talks or follow him on Twitter at https://twitter.com/TwitchiH for musings on the intersection of technology and society.

name: Richard PHAN CHAN THE
bio: I am an enthusiastic and hardworking IT professional, I have a strong Linux background, strong skills in system administration and automation, deep knowledge of microservices and Kubernetes

name: Rick Geerts
bio:
[rick ~]$ vim About

Founder of Digital Athletes. Consultant with a strong DevOps mindset. Actively working with open-source, container, orchestrator, cloud, and automation technologies. Open-minded and always eager to learn. In my spare time, I tinker around on my homelab, which I use to self-host applications (automated as much as possible) and try out new technologies.

:wq

name: Rio Kierkels
bio: I started in Visual Effects and Film, which sparked my fascination with large computer systems. Now, armed with a master's in Security and Network Engineering, my mission is to make technology work better for everyone. I design systems that are not only fast and secure but also easy and enjoyable to use. I love sharing what I've learned, helping wherever I can, and speaking about my work.

name: RISHABH SHARMA
bio: Rishabh is working as a senior software development engineer in Capgemini Finland Oy. He has proven track record of quickly learning and implementing cloud native tech solutions in telecom industry. He is currently responsible to implement and manage Kubernetes solution for 4G and 5G technologies. He is interested to be the contributor to Kubernetes. His other key areas of interest are Java, Spring-Boot, Containerd, Linux, Istio, Linkerd, Falco, Sysdig, CoreDNS, Helm, OPA (Open Policy Agent), Cilium, Envoy etc. He is the first Kubestronaut from FINLAND.

name: Rishit Dagli
bio: Rishit is a CS student at the University of Toronto. He spends most of his time researching and working with learning algorithms and vision. Currently, he also works as a research scientist intern at Qualcomm Research. He also maintains/contributes extensively to popular open-source projects like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Kubernetes, and Kubeflow among others and also frequently works on building new open-source projects. You will also often find him speaking at a CNCF conference.

name: Rob Mokkink
bio: Technical Architect for Openshift/Kubernetes platform for a large government organisation. I like working with the broad eco system and solutions for kubernetes. Where i can help i will participate in projects and contribute code.

name: Robert Reeves
bio: Robert is the VP of Business Development for The Cloud Native Computing Foundation. An early DevOps adopter and evangelist, he founded two successful development tool startups. Phurnace, acquired by BMC Software, was an application release solution for Java Enterprise applications. Liquibase is an open-source DevOps solution for databases. Robert brings decades of experience in developer tooling and business operations to help deliver the best developer experience to project contributors, maintainers, and project leaders. Robert is as passionate about open-source developers as he is about comic books, punk rock, and backpacking. A US Army veteran, Robert holds an Economics degree from the University of Texas at Austin and an MS degree in Science and Technology Commercialization from the McCombs School of Business. He lives in Austin, Texas with his partner, Maia, and son, Rex.

name: Robert Sirchia
bio: I create content around CNCF projects, building enablement content around CNCF projects. I help contribute around marketing and community efforts with CNCF projects. I am a new code contributor to a CNCF project

name: Roberth Strand
bio:
I am a self-proclaimed "cloud automator", and I work at Sopra Steria based out of Oslo, Norway. I have been granted the title of Microsoft MVP for my work with Azure, and I have been an active contributor in the CNCF for which I earned the title Cloud Native Ambassador. I initiated Cloud Native Norway, a non-profit that works to build up and enable Cloud Native adoption and development in Norway. I also co-founded the Azure Cloud Native User Group, and founded the Norwegian PowerShell User Group. In the CNCF, I have been active for years in TAG App Delivery, and currently serves as co-chair for the TAG, maintainer on the OpenGitOps project, and as co-chair of the Platforms Working Group.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: For many years, the CNCF has continued to impress me. The way that the foundation has supported the community and the projects is truly admirable. Even though I have other honorary titles, the CNCF Ambassador title is one that I value very much. While I don't do community work for the titles, I am happy for the recognition. I have big plans for my work in the CNCF, and I look forward to seeing how the ambassador program will help me achieve more for the community.

Sessionize: https://sessionize.com/roberth-strand

name: Roberto Colella
bio:
I'm a Senior Solution Engineer with over ten years of experience in IT, specializing in cloud-native technologies and practices.

My dedication revolves around promoting the adoption of CNCF technologies and contributing to community growth through sharing my knowledge and dedication to open-source projects.

Continuously embracing a beginner's mindset across life's challenges, I proficiently present technical concepts to diverse audiences, dedicated to achieving customer success and nurturing strong relationships.
company: Prisma Cloud by Palo Alto Networks

name: Roberto Galaz Alvarado
bio: DevOps Engineer at Veritas Automata, specializing in Kubernetes and cloud-native technologies, with a focus on automation, infrastructure as code, and Rust development

name: Roberto Magallanes
bio: Engineer passionate about technology and innovation, specializing in CNCF technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, and Prometheus.

name: Robin Smorenburg
bio:
Hello! I'm Robin Smorenburg, a passionate technologist with an eye for detail who turned his passion for technology into a career. Throughout my career, I’ve become a respected thought leader in the industry, sharing my knowledge and expertise with others, being recognized by Microsoft, and receiving the Microsoft Most Valuable Professional or MVP Award in the Azure category. With Kevin Evans, I run the StreamingClouds live stream, where we engage with inspiring individuals—our industry’s thought leaders—spreading positivity and sharing their knowledge and advice. And the StreamingClouds Community is a safe place where we’re helping each other, supported by a fantastic group of moderators we can call friends.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I’m really excited about joining the CNCF on the mission of "making cloud native ubiquitous". Enhancing my efforts of leading by example, inspiring and helping as many people as possible while being open and inclusive, and treating everyone with the utmost respect. Making a difference through community building and mentoring, impacting the lives of others, leveling the playing field, and fostering community collaboration and relationships. And last but not least, the technologist in me loves cloud-native!

name: Robson Franco
bio: IT professional with a 15-year career, currently fueled by challenges and opportunities of Cloud Computing.

name: Roby Chen
bio:
I am honored to continue serving in this role. Over the past few years, My company DaoCloud has made continuous contributions to the open-source community. Our contributions to Kubernetes, a core cloud-native project, have ranked among the top three globally over the past year. In 2022, we will also take on a contributing seat on Istio's steering committee. We have independently open-sourced nine projects, including Clusterpedia, Merbridge and Piraeus which have successfully entered CNCF Sandbox incubation. DaoCloud continues to contribute significantly towards cloud-native technology and improve CNCF's technical ecosystem.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Firstly, I hope that cloud-native technology will remain highly connected to China, and that the integration of the technology world will not be affected by geography, politics, international conflicts and other factors. Secondly, I hope that cloud-native technology can break through the barriers between technology and users, and that more end-user voices can be fed back to CNCF. Thirdly, I hope to promote the building of cloud-native technology talent and further improve the cloud-native education system, so that CNCF will become a sustainable organization.
company: SHANGHAI DAOCLOUD NETWORK TECHNOLOGY CO. LTD. (DAOCLOUD)

name: Rodolfo Campos
bio: I’m a technology enthusiast passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Software Development, DevSecOps and Cyber Security. Huge fan of Kubernetes and Kubeflow. I love to develop software, learn new things and automate workflows.

name: Rodolfo Martinez Vega
bio:
I'm a software developer and a Linux lover. I'm a co-organizer of Cloud Native Guadalajara and Golang Guadalajara meetups in Mexico. I love contributing to Open Source since it has helped me a lot in my career and meet amazing people.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'll reach out and help more people to start contributing to the Open Source. I'll encourage and motivate them to learn technologies to impact the world. Also, I'm excited to meet other ambassadors to learn from them and also help to grow our local communities.

name: Rodrigo Bersa
bio: Rodrigo is a Specialist Solutions Architect with expertise in Containers, Security, and Infrastructure-as-Code. With around 20 years of experience with Linux and OSS, he has navigated various modernization journeys, from virtualization and hypervisors to containers and microservices orchestration. His focus since 2016, is on Kubernetes platforms, aiming to help the Cloud Native Community in events like KCD Washington D.C, Cloud Native NoVA and KubeCon, covering aspects related to strategies and best practices for operational excellence, security, and reliability using Open Source tools.

name: Rodrigo Gonçalves Torres
bio: I am an AWS-certified Solutions Architect Professional, currently serving as an administrator for several on-premises Kubernetes clusters at a major oil company in Brazil. I have extensive knowledge in automating processes, particularly using Bash, Python, Terraform, and Ansible. Additionally, I work with GitOps, with a particular focus on Flux, and I am well-versed in using Helm.

name: ROHAN RAJGURU
bio: I am a Linux and Open Source enthusiast, still new to Kubernetes and cloud-native, and I'm loving it! I enjoy implementing the tools and concepts I've learned. These days, I’ve also started documenting my journey on LinkedIn and my blog. Let's connect!

name: Rohit Ghumare
bio:
Rohit Ghumare is a recognized Google Developer Expert specializing in Google Cloud Modern Architecture, a testament to his adeptness in contemporary cloud solutions. He is the driving force behind several community-centric initiatives, orchestrating events as the organizer of DevOpsDays Bengaluru, KCD Mumbai, Google Cloud Mumbai, and the Cloud Native Thane community group. Through these platforms, he not only showcases his profound expertise but also fosters a collaborative ecosystem for knowledge exchange. A prolific writer, Rohit has authored a plethora of blogs and insightful pieces on CNCF projects, including, but not limited to, Backstage, Istio, Kubernetes, Cilium, Envoy, Prometheus, and Kiali. This extensive coverage underscores his profound understanding and engagement with cutting-edge cloud-native technologies. Besides penning down his knowledge, Rohit is dedicated to sharing his insights through the "Cloud Native Talks" podcast, which he hosts, and through global conferences and local meetups where he's presented multiple talks. He has also been a program committee member for Kubecon co-located events. Links: devopsguys.in

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being appointed as an ambassador presents a remarkable opportunity to further extend the outreach of my engagement within the tech community, particularly in the realms of DevOps and Cloud Native technologies. It will help me to give back to the community by sharing insights from experts located all over the world.

name: Rohit Ramteke
bio: Part time Cloud Engineer, Full time Gamer

name: Roman Melnyk
bio: Problem-solver by heart or Platform Engineer by profession, specializing in the deployment and management of Apache Kafka and Kubernetes. Over the years, I have distinguished myself for a result-oriented approach to problem-solving, coupled with a strong aptitude for empathy and critical thinking. These skills enable me to understand and address complex issues within various development environments, and to design solutions that cater to the specific needs of the project at hand. My ultimate goal is to leverage my expertise to architect systems that boost efficiency, improve workflow, and ultimately drive business success.

name: Romar Cablao
bio: Romar is a tech enthusiast with a keen interest in cloud-native technology. He holds multiple cloud certifications and is passionate about exploring the latest advancements in this rapidly evolving industry. As a lifelong learner, he continuously seeks out new methodologies and innovations to keep himself and his team ahead of the curve.

name: Ronald Petty
bio: Ronald Petty works as a principal consultant at RX-M, providing engineering and advisory services around Cloud Native and Artificial Intelligence technologies. Ron participated in creation of some of the Kubernetes certifications and has held all of them. He is also the chair of the Internet Society - US San Francisco Bay Area Chapter, volunteer member of the SF Bay ACM and IEEE. As member/co-lead of the CNCF AI WG, works to add clarity around AI and CN technology integration. The following white paper is an example of this groups contribution to the community, https://www.cncf.io/reports/cloud-native-artificial-intelligence-whitepaper/.

name: Ronit Banerjee
bio:
I am Ronit Banerjee, a pre-final year Computer Science Engineering Undergraduate student. Along with my academics, I have maintained a strong portfolio being an Open Source Developer at the projects incubated and graduated from The Linux Foundation and Cloud Native Computing Foundation. My enthusiasm with DevOps and Cloud Native helped me to secure scholarships like Travel Funding Scholarship and Dan Kohn Scholarship by The Linux Foundation and Cloud Native Computing Foundation to attend flagship conferences such as KubeCon + CloudNativeCon + Open Source Summit China 2023 at Shanghai and Open Source Summit Europe 2022 at Dublin. I also worked as an Open Source Developer in Google Summer of Code (GSoC) at DBpedia Association. Apart from my technical experience, I got my hands dirty in fostering the Cloud Native Ecosystem. I am also the Chapter Lead at Cloud Native Hooghly which is an official CNCF Chapter listed amongst 40 such clubs in the Asia Pacific Region. Right now, with the proliferation of the Cloud Native Tools, I successfully turned the chapter to be the fastest growing in the entire Eastern India, catering 250+ Active members. I am also a Sig Contribex's Comms Volunteer for Kubernetes Contributors Summit North America 2023 at Chicago, United States of America primarily looking into the “Call for Proposal” emails and notifying about the updates to the KubeCon co-located event attendees. I have significant experience in pitching tech products to Venture Capitalists and have successfully secured grants from Government of India twice for my deep-tech startup.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I always wanted to boost Cloud Native Ecosystem in my locality whereas I felt there is a gap of awareness. Being an ambassador, it would really help me to reach areas where I couldn't do by myself just being a CNCG chapter lead of Hooghly. With CNCF's support it would be possible.

name: Roshan Anvekar
bio: Cloud automation/DevOps professional with good exposure to OpenStack and Kubernetes Infra environment.

name: Roushdy Ali
bio: Roushdy is a network and cloud senior consulting engineer with extensive experience designing and implementing network, virtualization, and cloud solutions. He has a keen interest in open-source and Cloud-Native technologies, particularly Kubernetes.

name: Rowan Voermans
bio: Rowan Voermans is a skilled platform engineer with extensive experience in Kubernetes and a specialized focus on GitOps. With a keen understanding of cloud-native technologies, Rowan has successfully designed and implemented scalable, automated infrastructure solutions for various organizations. His expertise in GitOps has enabled seamless and efficient continuous deployment processes, ensuring robust and reliable application delivery. Rowan's innovative approach and technical acumen make him a valuable asset in the field of platform engineering.

name: Rowland Onobrauche
bio: Open Source and Cloud Native enthusiast specialising in container orchestration on bare metal or in the cloud. I believe in containerising, automating and monitoring everything where it makes most sense. Kubernetes, Docker, Prometheus, Packer, Grafana, Terraform, Loki, Telegraf, InfluxDB and Ansible are the tools of choice.

name: Roy Liang
bio: I am a cloud native developer and advocator with over 6 years of experience in cloud native community. I was a cloud native infrastructure SRE and early Kubernetes contributor. I am currently working as a Senior R&D Engineer in Machine Learning Platform team at Tencent. I have participated in multiple cloud native projects and now I am working on cloud native AI infrastructure. I am also a co-author of "Istio Handbook", traslator of "Distributed Machine Learning Pattern" and speaker of KubeCon.

name: Ruben Knaus
bio: I have been working in the IT industry since 2001, starting my career in telecommunications and networking. Over the years, I have expanded my skillset to focus on Cloud and Kubernetes technologies. Currently, I am a Senior Systems Engineer, supporting various customers with a specialization in Kubernetes. I am known for my open-minded approach and my strong commitment to team and customer-oriented collaboration.

name: Rudzani Mashige
bio: Mechatronics & Robotics Engineering graduate by education, Cloud DevOps Engineer by profession, forever learner and ready to take on any challenge any time. Very passionate about opensource programs.

name: Rufat Zakirov
bio: Experienced Linux/DevOps Administrator proficient in CentOS, Ubuntu, and Red Hat.

name: Rustam Rakhimbayev
bio: I am IT specialist with more than 15 years of experience. Interesting in cloud native applications and deployment Work a lot either Kubernetes and microservices

name: Ryan Allen
bio: Past GIS specialty turned technologist. Specializing in distributed cloud native geographic data platforms. Curious about all things technology, with a special interest in Cloud, Kubernetes and security.

name: Ryan LI
bio: A Tech lover. Keep learning CNCF technologies.

name: Rynn Mancuso
bio:
Rynn Mancuso is the developer community manager at Honeycomb, one of the maintainers of OpenTelemetry’s End User SIG, and the creator of the OpenTelemetry in Practice meetup & the OTel Unplugged unconference. Before joining Honeycomb, they led developer communities at New Relic, Tidelift, Mozilla and Wikimedia. They also contribute to the Organization for Ethical Source.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am excited to be an ambassador because I'm getting to connect with lots of great people across all of the CNCF projects to make the cloud native ecosystem better. In my ambassadorship year, my goals are to take the great speakers we are cultivating in the observability community and help place them in as many general cloud native meetups as possible to spread the word about cloud native observability, to start a streaming series where we work with different CNCF projects to instrument them, and to get the word out about the end user work we've been doing within OpenTelemetry so other projects can better serve end users.

name: Ryoji Kobayashi
bio: Backend/DevOps engineer with hands-on experience in Linux systems, Golang, Docker, Kubernetes, and MySQL. Interested in operational improvement and automation using CI/CD, ArgoCD, Jenkins, etc., and building secure systems.

name: Rémi Verchère
bio: I began my career as a developer working on embedded solutions and gradually transitioned into operations, tackling diverse infrastructure challenges. With over a decade of experience collaborating with both development and operations teams, I have consistently championed Open Source solutions. My expertise lies in automation, observability, and cloud-native infrastructure. As a consultant for several years, I bring this knowledge to companies, helping them innovate and streamline their operations. As an Ops professional dedicated to supporting developers, I strive to bridge the gap between these domains and drive strategic technical success. I also love sharing what I learned, being a speaker at several conferences (Devoxx FR, KCD FR, DevOps D-Days), co-organizing local DevOps Aix-Marseille Meetup and writing some technical blog posts on my personal website https://www.vrchr.fr.

name: Sachin Kumar
bio: I am a senior Cloud Engineer at Ellucian with keen interest in Kubernetes technology .

name: Saed Farah
bio:
A Security Engineer at Google, with a strong passion for community collaboration. As a community leader I enjoy advocateing for all things security, cloud and containers.

I run a weekly newsletter called: 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗘𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸𝗹𝘆 - 𝗦𝗲𝗰𝘂𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗘𝗱𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. I also enjoy creating videos where I demonstrate cutting edge tech containerised in an attempt to make knowledge more accessible to the community.

name: Saeid Bostandoust
bio: Software engineer since 2005, Mad on learning new things, Eat, Sleep, Kubernetes; I've been working with Kubernetes in production environments since 2016 and have worked on some 500 Kubernetes-based projects since then. At Kubedemy.io, we provide consultation, implementation and enterprise training services for Kubernetes and almost all CNCF-based projects. I can be there for you if you're looking for someone to solve tough Kubernetes challenges.

name: Sagar Utekar
bio:
Working as MTS3 Site Reliability Engineer at VMWare Software India PVT. LTD. Cloud Native Day Pune (CND Pune’23) Organizer Kubernetes Community Day Pune (KCD’24) Organizer Open-Source Enthusiast, A firm believer in the power of community education. Google Summer Of Code Admin since 2018, Mentor, Mentee 2022 @PEcAn Project GSoD, GSSoC, Github Externship, SIH mentor CKS | CKA | CKAD | Terraform Certified Mentored 10k+ students & professionals for free across India for career guidance, Job Search, Open Source, Cloud Native Docker & CNCG Pune community leader Enjoys photography, Acting, Teaching, Trekking, fitness

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I have been organising monthly meetups under CNCG Pune chapter, have been sharing my knowledge by speaking at different events, conferences, rural area colleges, schools, local meet-up groups to spread awareness and share knowledge about cloud native. By becoming CNCF Ambassador I will get more support, training, mentorship, guidance and rewards to build stronger community which will open wide door of the opportunities - to network with other community leaders, CNCF leaders and share my knowledge to wider audience. As part of CNCF Ambassador, it will give me opportunity to network with equally passionate Ambassadors from all over the globe. CNCF Ambassador gets support, mentorship, trainings, funding to host the events which will help me a lot to foster a strong community and upcoming events. It will give me the opportunity to promote Cloud Native technologies projects globally.

name: Sahil Anand
bio: I am a seasoned Kubernetes specialist and an avid IT and cloud enthusiast. With a wealth of expertise spanning Kubernetes, Cloud, Networking, DevOps, Monitoring, design and architecture, I have established myself as a versatile professional in the tech industry. My proficiency is not limited to hands-on technical skills; I have also excelled and love to impart knowledge. I have keen interest and have delivered numerous technical trainings on a wide array of topics such as Cloud, Kubernetes, DevOps, Networking, and Troubleshooting, etc. helping many professionals and organizations advance their technological capabilities.

name: Sai Linn Thu
bio:
Sai is currently working as Senior Solutions Architecture Specialist, APJ at HashiCorp and is based out of Singapore. Sai started his career in Networking and had 17 years of experience in private/public cloud infrastructure solutions for highly regulated security-conscious industries such as Banking, Financial Services Industries, Aviation, ISPs and Public Sector organizations across APJ Region. Previously He was part of the Field Engineering team at solo.io, Professional Services Consultant (APJ) at chef.io. He focuses on modernizing infrastructure automation and microservices application networking from Edge to Service Mesh at scale, where the tech stacks are built on HashiCorp Vault, Consul, Boundary, Terraform, Chef, Istio, Envoy Proxy, eBPF, Cilium, GraphQL built for Kubernetes, VMs & Cloud.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Singapore and ASEAN Region need more active and organized meetups around cloud native community. The activities are behind compare to US, EMEA and ANZ Region. As an ambassador, I will continue to create more awareness and advocate CNCF projects in Singapore and ASEAN Region. I am also participating for the KubeDay Singapore as one of the event chairs, and continue to contribute. I'm very proud of being CNCF Ambassador and representing CNCF in Singapore and APAC Region.

name: Saikrishna Gorantla
bio: With a decade-long tenure in DevOps and SRE roles, I possess a strong drive for innovation and thrive in dynamic environments. My career has been anchored in cloud infrastructure, with a primary focus on Microsoft Azure. Key proficiencies include expert management of Kubernetes environments, pioneering cloud-native development strategies, architecting scalable microservices solutions, deploying and managing operators, automating CI/CD workflows, implementing comprehensive observability frameworks, and fortifying infrastructure through rigorous security protocols.

name: Saim Safdar
bio:
Hello, my name is Saim Safdar, working as a Developer Relations Manager at Rafay Systems, host of the cloud-native podcast (https://www.youtube.com/@cloudnativefm), co-founder of Cloud Native Islamabad (https://community.cncf.io/islamabad/), Organizer of KCD Pakistan (https://www.cncf.io/blog/2023/03/10/from-community-group-to-event-a-kcd-pakistan-experience/). Maintainer of the cncf Sandbox project, Paralus (https://www.paralus.io/).

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I love sharing my Open Source jourey with others, currently there's a desparate need of mentorship within the community, as cloud native eco-system constantly equipped with new tooling, students, tech pro, difficult to find and map existing knowledge to work with OS and communities, I'm hoping my time as an Ambassador, I'll get on-board and shortened the loop for code to contribution to outreaching new OS tooling to the world.

name: Saiyam Pathak
bio: Saiyam is working as Principal Developer Advocate at Loft Labs. He is the founder of Kubesimplify, focusing on simplifying cloud-native and Kubernetes technologies. Previously at Civo, Walmart Labs, Oracle, and HP, Saiyam has worked on many facets of Kubernetes, including machine learning platforms, scaling, multi-cloud, and managed Kubernetes services. He has implemented Kubernetes solutions in various organizations. When not coding, Saiyam contributes to the community by writing blogs and organizing local meetups for Kubernetes and CNCF. He is also a CNCF TAG sustainability lead, runs a YouTube channel, and can be reached on Twitter @saiyampathak

name: Sajeeva Nambadawa Vithanage
bio: A security-conscious technology fanatic with over 12 years of experience, I am deeply passionate about cloud-native designs and architecture. In addition to my Kubernetes certifications, I hold several other certifications, including Istio Certified Associate, Prometheus Certified Associate, Associate Cloud Engineer (GCP), Professional Cloud Database Engineer, AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate, Terraform Associate, 5 X Oracle, RHCE, CCNA, and Certified Ethical Hacker.

name: Saleh Alshamlan
bio: A Software Engineer that is passionate about DevOps, Software Architecture & Design and Cloud Platforms & Technologies. Along with a major interest and multiple years of experience in Kubernetes and Containerization.

name: Sammy Cheung
bio: Sammy is a technology expert with over 30 years of experience in software development and systems architecture. He is an AWS Gold Jacket Ambassador, a multi-cloud certified all-star, and a Kubestronaut. Sammy is passionate about empowering people to upskill and accelerate business success in Cloud technology.

name: Sander Sneekes
bio: With over 20 years of IT experience, I specialize in designing and implementing cloud-native solutions for large-scale environments, leveraging Kubernetes and Rancher for container orchestration. My extensive skills in building scalable and resilient cloud-native applications are complemented by my proficiency in implementing CI/CD pipelines, automating software delivery and deployment for efficient management of containerized applications. My consultancy services are highly sought after due to personal recommendations, highlighting the trust and confidence my clients have in my expertise. Additionally, I have a strong background in software development with expertise in NestJS, NodeJS, and VUE, enabling me to create modern and efficient full-stack web applications, RESTful APIs, and microservices. My comprehensive experience ensures I can provide end-to-end solutions for clients, integrating cloud-native architectures, Kubernetes deployments, and CI/CD pipelines with a modern tech stack.

name: Sander van Bruggen
bio: I work as a DevOps Engineer at Fullstaq and recently discovered a passion for the Cloud Native environment, particularly Kubernetes.

name: Sander van Schie
bio: I am a devoted engineer, who has a strong passion for public cloud technology focusing on AWS and GCP. I am experienced in Kubernetes, Terraform as well as cloud-native technologies, which makes me excel in creating robust, secure and scalable infrastructures. My strong sense of duty and being quick on my feet are what keep me going all the time.

name: Sandhya Subba Rao
bio: I'm Sandhya. I'm passionate about learning new technologies and implementing them in our day-to-day activities. I have been working on Kubernetes for past 4 years nearly. Have built Kubernetes clusters locally and implemented CI/CD frameworks which run as part of any merges to the Git repo. Have also worked with Vault, Istio, Prometheus and other DevOps tools.

name: Sandipan Panda
bio: Sandipan enjoys collaborating with people on developing software. He is a Member, Community Manager, and part of the Contributor Experience Special Interest Group and the Contributor Communications team at Kubernetes. Sandipan has been a Mentee at CNCF under the Linux Foundation Mentorship Program, where he worked on Cilium, and a Google Summer of Code Contributor 2024 at Kubeflow. As a participant in CNCF Security Slam 2023, he has also contributed to improving the security hygiene of Kubernetes subprojects. Sandipan is a CNCF Community Groups Organizer of the Kolkata chapter.

name: Sandro Kaspar
bio: DevOps Engineer at VSHN, fueled by a passion for Kubernetes, CI/CD, IaC and Cloud technologies. Transforming digital infrastructure with innovation and automation.
company: VSHN Canada - The DevOps Company Inc.

name: Sanjay Chauhan
bio: As a Chief DevOps Architect at Panamax Inc., I specialise in cloud computing, infrastructure automation, and Kubernetes orchestration. My expertise extends to creating scalable, secure, and efficient cloud solutions across AWS, Azure, and GCP. Reach me at sanjay1chauhan1@gmail.com for consulting inquiries.

name: Sanjay Sachdev
bio: Hi there, I am Sanjay Sachdev and I work at Red Hat as a Senior Cloud Consultant. I work in a customer facing, pre-sales and post-sales solution designing role at Red Hat, primarily focusing on customer adoption of Kubernetes and other cloud-native technologies. In my free time I like to write blogs on the technologies and tools that I have been exploring. Following is a link to my blog posts - https://medium.com/@ssachdev-pros

name: SANJU RAJ
bio: I am a Red Hat Certified Architect with a commitment to sharing my knowledge and hands-on experience with others. My journey with IT industry began in 2009 when I worked with Microsoft Exchange Server. However, my interest in IT soon led to me explore Red Hat. My pivotal moment came when I was introduced to the world of containers through a course titled as "Red Hat OpenShift Administration Course" in 2017. This ignited my curiosity and I began delving into the containers and container orchestrations. Today as a Learning and Development Instructor with Red Hat India Private Limited, I focus on delivering training modules related to Red Hat OpenShift, Red Hat Ansible Automation and emerging technologies.

name: Sanket Nadkarni
bio: A Cloud Platform Engineer, based in India, specializing in Kubernetes, cloud-native technologies, and infrastructure automation.

name: Santiago David Ramos Copo
bio: With nearly two decades of experience in the IT field, I have tackled a wide range of technology challenges, from software development and systems management to implementing innovative solutions for digital transformation. Stay teachable is my natural state, always learning and sharing the knowledge. I love technology and the benefits it can bring to people. Seriously convinced that to be a great professional, you must first be a great person.

name: Santosh Nukala
bio: Eagerly pursues knowledge in the ever-evolving field of CNCF technologies ,driven by deep-seated curiosity to innovate and optimize cloud and container security practices.

name: Sara Trappetti
bio:
I started my journey in Tech Marketing in 2016, and in 2021, I embarked with SIGHUP on the Cloud Native industry as a complete newbie. For the first six months, I felt overwhelmed by the vastness and complexity of the field, but then something amazing happened along the way – thanks to my stubbornness and the patient support of my colleagues, I actively started contributing to the Cloud Native community and found a perfect place to express my skills while helping others, organizing events, and supporting projects - I'm a KCD Italy and Cloud Native Milano Meetup organizer and part of the Glossary Italian Localization Group. All that apart, I'm music-passionate and a restless shower performer, a winter couch knitter and cat cuddler, a balcony gardening ace, a dabble baker, and a great backwarmer during adventurous motorcycle journeys.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a non-tech member and a proud CNCF ambassador, I'm determined to lend my support in any way possible. I'm here to share the lessons I've learned, contribute to the growth of our community, and empower others to discover the Cloud Native Community and find their own path. I want to be a guiding hand to help others navigate CNCF initiatives and projects. It's all about showing that there are different ways to contribute and various subgroups tailored to their expertise.

name: Sascha Gorgievski
bio: With several years of experience, Sascha Gorgievski is a dedicated Cloud DevOps Engineer specializing in running Kubernetes across various cloud platforms and on-premise environments. His notable achievements include establishing an AKS landing zone with Terraform/IaC, laying the foundations for large-scale application migrations, and implementing key CNCF projects such as Flux, Cilium, and Prometheus. Sascha has contributed to industries including finance and banking, telecommunications, and healthcare, consistently bringing a customer-focused and security-aware mindset to every project.

name: Sascha Grunert
bio:
Sascha works on many different container related open-source projects like Kubernetes and various container runtimes. He joined the CNCF community back in 2018, having gained container experience before. Sascha's passions include contributing to open source, as well as giving talks and evangelizing Kubernetes-related technologies.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm thrilled to act as CNCF ambassador because mentoring and onboarding new people into the community is one of my passions! The CNCF ambassador program provides me a bigger context to connect with new and existing community members. It also makes it easier for me to boost the visibility of open source projects while evangelizing best practices, code of conduct and openness.

name: Sathish Kumar Venkatesan
bio: Sathish Kumar is a seasoned IT professional with over 16 years of diverse experience, specializing in cloud technologies, DevOps and system administration practices. As a Principal Cloud Customer Engineer at the Royal Bank of Canada, he excels in delivering tailored Kubernetes solutions and ensuring high system reliability. Strongly focused on continuous learning, and consistently developing security solutions. With expertise spanning Kubernetes, Azure, AWS, and GCP, he possesses a profound understanding of cloud infrastructure, application deployment and automation, complemented by outstanding analytical and communication skills. Passionate about giving back to the community, Sathish actively contributes to to various open-source projects, including those under the CNCF, such as Backstage, Istio, etc. He stays at the forefront of technology trends in the ever-evolving world of IT.

name: Satyam Soni
bio: Satyam is Google Summer of Mentee 2024 at OpenSUSE, and Kubernetes Release team member and Cloud Native New Delhi Organizer.He focuses on developing and contributing to open-source software. He holds a good track record of contributions to various projects, communities, and he is currently an active contributor to the Kubernetes project.

name: Sauharda Shrestha
bio: An SRE with a passion for keeping up to date with the newest tech and tools. In spare time, you can catch me unwinding on Xbox.

name: Saurabh Dubey
bio: Greetings, my name is Saurabh Dubey I am passionately seeking to expand my understanding in the constantly changing area of CNCF technologies, motivated by a strong desire to create and enhance security methods for cloud and container environments. I am employed at Mobileum Hong Kong as a Technical Delivery Manager and possess expertise in collaborating with Helm, Kubernetes, Container Network Interface (CNI), Argo, cert-manager, Calico AWS Cloud Architect/DevOps specialist.

name: Saurabh Kadam
bio: I specialize in cloud infrastructure automation, DevSecOps methodology, and AWS optimization. My expertise spans Kubernetes orchestration, containerization with Docker, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code using Terraform and Ansible. I have extensive experience with tools such as Helm, Istio for service mesh, and Kustomize, while managing cloud services like EC2, S3, CloudFront, Route53, and RDS in AWS environments. I also focus on monitoring and observability using Prometheus and Grafana, as well as enhancing security through Falco and Open Policy Agent (OPA). My proficiency in Linux, Nginx, Jenkins, and scripting with Bash enables me to automate complex workflows and optimize performance. Certified across multiple cloud-native and DevOps technologies, I am dedicated to delivering scalable, secure, and cost-efficient solutions. For inquiries, reach me at devops.saurabhkadam@gmail.com

name: Savitha Raghunathan
bio:
Savitha Raghunathan is a Senior Software Engineer at Red Hat, currently focusing on Application Modernization and Cloud Native adoption. Her role as a maintainer for the CNCF Sandbox project Konveyor has provided her with valuable insights into the growing demand for modernizing critical applications to align with cloud-native technologies, thereby deepening her understanding of the application lifecycle. In her previous position, Savitha worked as a platform engineer, where she dedicated herself to building internal developer platforms using Kubernetes and other cloud native projects.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Contributing to CNCF projects has been incredibly fulfilling, and the support and positivity I've experienced from the community during difficult periods, including the pandemic, have deepened my bond with this community. This role as a CNCF Ambassador has given me a chance to reciprocate that support, share my valuable experiences, and facilitate the onboarding of new contributors and adopters into the CNCF ecosystem.

name: Scott Rigby
bio:
Scott is a Brooklyn based interdisciplinary artist and Developer Advocate. He co-founded the Basekamp art and research group in 1998 and the massively collaborative Plausible Artworlds international network. In technology he enjoys helping develop open source software that anyone can use, most recently projects in the cloud native landscape including co-maintaining Helm, Flux, and OpenGitOps. He helps organize groups such as NYC Kubernetes meetup and CNCF GitOps Working Group under TAG App Delivery. In daily decisions large or small, he tries to help make the world a better place for everyone.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I deeply enjoy helping members of the wider open source community, specifically the CNCF and LF project communities. I try to lift others up whenever possible: through co-presenting talks, replying in Slack, amplifying the work of others, welcoming new people to meetings, helping ensure meetings run smoothly, helping with CNCF Working Group and project governance, and generally being an ally. I'm particularly interested in continuing to encourage cross-project collaboration and alignment between people in CNCF TAGs, WGs and projects. I'm also very dedicated to continuing to help new people step up contributor ladders (and encouraging the creation of those ladders when not present), specifically getting involved in things like project pull request reviews, design discussions, and communication processes around projects and WGs.

name: Sean Hanson
bio: Sean Hanson is a dedicated IT professional and cloud native enthusiast, with a strong focus on ongoing learning. He leverages his expanding skillset to empower others, guiding them on their own technology journeys.

name: Sebastiaan Kok
bio: I am a seasoned cloud-native technology specialist with extensive experience in CNCF projects, particularly Kubernetes, since 2019. My expertise is grounded in a strong foundation in Linux, which I have been working with since 2011. Currently, I specialize in platform engineering, optimizing infrastructure to ensure scalable and efficient cloud-native applications.

name: Sebastian Dahl
bio: Sebastian is a Cloud and DevOps Engineer specializing in kubernetes, cloud technologies and IaC

name: Sebastien Prune THOMAS
bio:
I've been involved and passionated by the CNCF community for many years ! I'm co-organizing the Canadian CNCF & Kubernetes meetups for Canada (virtual) and Quebec City / Montreal meetups in person with other wonderful Organizers and Ambassadors ! I'm also a speaker in other meetups, at 2022 KubeCon US and at KubeCon's Rejeks 2023. I love sharing my experience and documenting. I try to blog my projects and experiences. Check at https://medium.com/@prune998 I'm invested in some CNCF or OSS projects linked to K8s and I'm maintaining an official fork of KubeColor that was unmaintained for years: https://github.com/kubecolor/kubecolor I've been patching a lot of projects, OSS or CNCF, like ArgoCD, Cilium, Kafka tools...

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: My goal as an ambassador is to promote Kubernetes and the wonderful ecosystem under the CNCF banner. Being involved in the Ambassador community will help me grow my skills at communicating and hopefully inspire others to join the movement.

name: Sehyeong Kim
bio: I'm working as a DevOps Engineer with Luxoft. The technologies I'm working on are CI/CD with Jenkins, Kubernetes and Docker. And I'm passionate in cloud-native projects like Istio, Helm, ArgoCD and learning cloud security domain. I love sharing my knowledge related to DevOps and cloud-native projects.
slack_id: ksh349021@gmail.com But I'm not in the CNCF workspace now.

He is experienced in public cloud(AWS), Infrastructure as Code (Ansible), GitOps, Kubernetes, and other related cloud-native technologies. He also holds several advanced certifications of public cloud.

name: Senee Tantaso

Whether it's containerization with Docker and Kubernetes, configuration management with Ansible, or infrastructure as code with Terraform, I'm always eager to explore new technologies and apply them to real-world scenarios. I'm deeply committed to fostering collaboration and driving positive change within organizations. Whether it's working closely with cross-functional teams to streamline processes, mentoring junior colleagues, or championing a culture of automation and innovation, I believe in the power of teamwork to achieve shared goals and drive success.

name: Sezen Erdem
bio: Dev-Ops Enginner. Dealing with setting up Kubernetes Clusters on-prem and interested in private cloud infrastructures.

He helped curate KubeWeekly newsletter for the past 1 year and authored the contribution guidelines for the newsletter. He is passionate about Kubernetes and actively contributes to CNCF projects.

name: Shedrack Akintayo

Holds all certifications in Kubernetes, AWS Cloud. I have been interested in declarative infrastructure definition and am familiar with Kubernetes and IaC (Terraform).

name: Shinya Ishitobi
bio: I joined Accenture in 2024 as a new graduate and currently work as an Architect with expertise in AWS, Google Cloud, Terraform, Ansible, Golang, and Kubernetes. I have a keen interest in distributed systems and MLOps. My mission is to lead a renaissance in Japan’s software industry, building an ecosystem where young developers can flourish and perform at their peak, ultimately placing Japan at the forefront of global technology. Last but not least, I am dedicated to driving innovation in cloud-native technologies, contributing to the growth of this vibrant community, and expanding my network with fellow enthusiasts!

name: Shivay Lamba

He is actively involved in community work as well. He is a TensorflowJS SIG member, Mentor in OpenMined and CNCF Service Mesh Community, SODA Foundation
