He has been a contributor to Kubernetes, Kyverno and KubeArmor. He co-organizes the CNCF Chandigarh Chapter.

name: Wael Ayadi
bio: I am a cloud and DevOps consultant with 10 years of experience in the IT industry. I began my career as a system administrator before transitioning into the world of cloud and DevOps. Over the years, I have tackled numerous challenges by participating in IT projects and honing my skills in technologies such as AWS, Terraform, Kubernetes, Helm, ArgoCD, and many others. A big fan of CNCF solutions, I continuously strive to stay at the forefront of innovations in this field.

name: Ward
bio: I am a seasoned System Engineer with many years of experience managing software delivery. I am passionate about Linux, containers and networking.

name: Wayman Smith
bio: Wayman is a Senior Cloud Architect with a passion for Linux, Kubernetes, and generally all things technology. He brings extensive expertise in designing and delivering robust, and cost-effective solutions across various cloud providers and technologies to meet varying use cases. Wayman has a proven track record of leveraging the Cloud Native landscape in assisting companies of all sizes leverage the power of Kubernetes. My thoughts on technology can be found on my medium account, waymanls.medium.com.

name: Wee Liat Ng
bio: Wee Liat began his journey with container technologies prior to 2020 and since then, he has been actively deploying web applications on the Kubernetes platform. Wee Liat is also consistently exploring niche and cutting-edge technology developments.

name: Wei Wang
bio:
I am the organizer of CNCF Community China, ShenZhen, and the author of , , and , specializing in Kubernetes, Docker, cloud-native architecture, and microservices.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm very happy to be part of the new CNCF Ambassador program once again, and to finally be able to bring more technical evangelism to the community and organize community events again!

name: Wendi West
bio: Wendi has been working as a Meeting + Event Planner for The Linux Foundation since 2014 with her primary focus being CNCF’s KubeCon+CloudNativeCon events (since late 2016) where she manages the scholarship program and DEI activities, and acts as a liaison between the PR and Events team for Media + Analyst engagement at events. Wendi has produced corporate and non-profit events for over 15 years. She holds a BA from California State University, Fullerton and a certification in grant writing from the Center of NonProfit Management.

name: Whitney Lee
bio: Whitney is a kind and welcoming human who enjoys understanding and using tools in the cloud native landscape. Creative and driven, Whitney has created and delivered two KubeCon keynotes, a VMware Explore keynote, and countless fun, funny, and informative community conference keynotes. You can catch her lightboard streaming show ⚡️ Enlightning on her YouTube channel, she co-hosts the streaming show You Choose! - a 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure'-style journey through the CNCF landscape alongside Viktor Farcic, she is one of the hosts of Cloud Native Live on the CNCF YouTube channel, and she co-hosts the podcast Software Defined Interviews with Michael Coté.

name: Willem BERROUBACHE
bio: As a Security Architect at a leading telecom company in Europe, I oversee an essential project aimed at strengthening the security framework of 5G networks, with a focus on Telco Cloud infrastructure. My role is to actively promote cloud-native technologies within the company, advocating for their strategic implementation to enhance our services. In addition to my project management duties, I am committed to regularly training my colleagues on Kubernetes, Linux, Prometheus, cloud-native ecosystems, and observability practices, ensuring that our team remains at the cutting edge of industry developments. As a cloud technology enthusiast, I am constantly seeking ways to improve my skills and deepen my knowledge in these technologies, as well as other rapidly evolving fields.

name: William Conway
bio: I specialize in performance testing for Dell VxRail and ACP for Azure platforms, we ensuring optimal system efficiency and reliability. Day to day we develop Kubernetes-based tools to streamline and enhance testing processes. Our work focuses on integrating cutting-edge technology for robust infrastructure and automation.

name: William Rizzo
bio:
I'm focused in helping customers designing, building, and running their Kubernetes and Internal Developer Platforms. I wore many hats in the IT world, Engineering, Pre-Post sales, Product Owner and Consulting. from HPC, Storage and Distributed Systems. I also enjoy volunteering at the Dutch Cloud Native/Kubernetes Meetup and the NL KCD. I have lived in many European countries and now Netherlands is the place I call home.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a CNCF Ambassador is the confirmation that my efforts towards the Open Source community are heading in the right direction. I'm excited to help the community and being supported and by the CNCF while doing it

name: Wing Tsui
bio: I began my IT career as a backend developer by learning to build and run containerized apps on cloud platforms. This sparked my fascination with cloud-native technologies, and I have continued to explore them ever since. Stay hungry, stay foolish, stay curious, and stay humble to tech.

name: Wiriyang Pipatsakulroj
bio: Wiriyang is Senior Cloud Architect at a consulting company. He used to work at a big cloud service provider. His passions are about performance computing and cloud technology especially scheduling, observability and service mesh projects in CNCF.

name: Wojciech Guzik
bio: Works as Cloud Engineer, focuses on stable and resilient solutions. Has tendency to enable platforms for developers.

name: Woojin Na
bio: As a Cloud Architect at SAMSUNG SDS Cloud Division, I design Networks, Storage, and Security using Kubernetes. I am also passionate about exploring Cilium and organizing Kubernetes meetups within my company.

name: Xiaohui Zhang
bio:
Senior cloud native architect and evangelist at Flomesh. I am a seasoned programmer, LF APAC open source evangelist, CNCF Ambassador, member of the cloud native community committee(China local) and Microsoft Azure MVP. With many years of microservice and infrastructure practice experience, mainly involving microservices, containers, Kubernetes, DevOps, etc. In the past there years, I organize two meetups in Guangzhou and Service Mesh Conference in Shanghai together with community members. In the coming April 15, I will organize KCD in Dalian with other community members. I own a Chinese blog https://atbug.com and start writing on Medium https://addozhang.medium.com.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: Being a CNCF ambassador is a recognition of my involvement in open source and cloud-native technology promotion over the past few years. After becoming a CNCF ambassador, I can better promote CNCF technology and organize more in-person and virtual events. At the same time, I can also receive more support from CNCF.

name: Xin Zhang
bio: Xin is the VP of Volcano Engine, previously CEO & co-founder of Caicloud and an ex-Googler. Xin has been actively involved in cloud native technology innovation, helping Chinese enterprises to achieve enterprise digital transformation and intelligence.

name: Xu Jin'An
bio: An experienced infrastructure professional, you have been part of deployment teams implementing diverse platforms using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Ansible and Terraform. Your deployments span big data systems at Petabyte scale, enterprise storage, and Azure Cloud environments. With expertise in cloud solutions, containerized applications, and AI/ML workloads on NVIDIA AI Enterprise, you specialize in leveraging Terraform and Kubernetes to modernize workloads and streamline cloud-native infrastructure deployments.

name: Yahya Alshamrani
bio: Driven, dedicated, and proactive, I approach every challenge with innovative and resourceful solutions, always eager to learn and experiment with new technologies.

name: Yannick Englert
bio: After completing my apprenticeship in 2016, I spent seven years working full-time for a telecommunications company as a DevOps engineer. In that role, I provided and maintained a container platform (PaaS) utilising CloudFoundry and Kubernetes. Currently, I work as a DevOps/Platform Engineer at an SME, where my responsibilities include supporting and developing our Kubernetes-based container platform, as well as education and enabling colleques and customers on their Cloud Native journey.

name: Yao-Siang Su
bio: Yao-Siang Su, a software architect with experience in the Kubernetes ecosystem and distributed systems. In recent years, he and his team have helped Taiwan's largest job bank website on its journey toward cloud-native. In addition to using CNCF projects such as Kubernetes, Prometheus, Argo CD, Helm, and Istio, he also enjoys using HashiCorp Vault to accomplish various tasks. In addition to cloud-native technologies, he also enjoys reading and learning the fundamentals of distributed systems and finds great joy in it.

name: Andy Peng
bio:
PNW local. Seasoned software product builder and technologist based in Seattle (WA). Expertise in large-scale distributed systems and cloud computing: AI, ML + Data, containers & virtualization, serverless compute, open-source. Diverse experience encompassing both people management and technical leadership, including cross-company collaborations. Community Lead of Cloud Native Seattle. Technical advisory board. Guest lecturer of University of Washington. Photographer, Music lover, have a taylor made in walnut, and I love Icewine. Homepage: https://pengandy.com/

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I am thrilled to be joining the CNCF Ambassador program. As someone who is deeply passionate about building and promoting fundamental technologies, particularly in the realm of Cloud Native solutions, I feel grateful for the opportunity to deepen my connections with the community and share my knowledge and experience with open-source users around the globe. By being part of this program, I hope to make a broader impact and bring even more value to Linux Foundation and CNCF. Additionally, I am eager to learn more about the needs of users and help them understand how they can effectively use cloud native and container technology to solve their problems.

name: Yash Gandhi
bio: I work as a Vice President at Morgan Stanley's Cloud Foundation Engineering Department, primarily responsible for the foundational engineering and architecture of the Multi-Cloud Kubernetes Platform for the Firm to suit various business applications needs within Financial Services. I've also been a speaker at KubeDay Singapore 2023. My technical experience include plethora of technologies like Kubernetes, Gitops, Service Mesh, Golang, Terraform and many more.

name: Yash Pimple
bio: Yash is a passionate advocate for cloud-native technologies and community building. As a pre-final year student pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in India, Yash is deeply involved in the CNCF ecosystem. Serving as a co-organizer of the Cloud-native Thane community, Yash regularly hosts meetups and workshops to foster learning and growth within the community. With active contributions to the Keptn organization, Yash is dedicated to advancing the CNCF mission through leadership, advocacy, and technical expertise.

name: Yashkumar Barot
bio: I am a skilled Site Reliability Engineer with over 4 years of expertise in cloud technologies, containerization, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC). I excel in automating cloud infrastructure, optimizing deployment processes, and have a specialty in multi-cloud environments. My experience also includes working as a DevOps Engineer, enhancing my ability to build and maintain resilient systems. Passionate about CNCF technologies, I hold numerous certifications. In my free time, I enjoy playing cricket, video games, and reading books.

name: yashwanth k suruneni
bio: I am a software engineer turned dev-ops engineer. I found Kubernetes fascinating so i started mastering it. I am currently learning go so that i can contribute to it.

He helps organisations in their Digital transformation journey majorly on micro-services and cloud. He incessantly masters emerging technologies and diligently endeavours to remain fully apprised of the latest industry developments.

name: Yevhen Skyba
bio: As a Lead DevOps Engineer, I bring a wealth of experience in cloud architecture, infrastructure automation, and CI/CD. I specialise in driving DevOps initiatives, managing intricate infrastructures, and ensuring flawless deployment processes across various projects. My expertise spans AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform, with strong scripting skills in Python, Bash, and PowerShell. I hold numerous certifications, reflecting my commitment to ongoing learning and professional excellence. I am passionate about harnessing advanced technologies to achieve business objectives, and I thrive on tackling new challenges and contributing to significant projects.

name: Yifan Bian
bio: Managing Kubernetes infrastructure on Azure hosting cloud-native services with heavy load.

name: Yogesh Rathore
bio: Yogesh Rathore As a Principal DevOps Engineer with over 10 years of experience, specializing in cloud-native technologies like Kubernetes, Helm charts, Rancher, and Docker. I am focused on writing efficient, scalable, cloud native applications which leverages CNCF projects such as Kubernetes.I am focused on writing efficient, scalable, cloud native applications which leverages CNCF projects such as Kubernetes. I have a passion for building scalable infrastructures on hybrid cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure and GCP automating cloud infrastructure with tools like Chef and Ansible. Currently, managing large-scale microservices deployments while leading the COE-DevOps team to drive innovation and efficiency. I actively contribute to the DevOps community through Kubernetes meetups, open-source projects, and my blog on cloud-native technologies. Let’s connect and explore the exciting world of cloud-native solutions together

name: Yonathan Cedillos
bio: Senior DevOps Engineer with expertise configuring Flux and Argo and managing Cloud Infrastructure and Kubernetes cluster on AWS, GCP and Azure and recently Rancher for on-premise clusters. I also have experience configuring Prometheus and Grafana Stack for monitoring and observability.

name: Yongkang He
bio:
Yongkang is a Principal Containers Specialist based in Singapore supporting Asia Pacific. He shifted the focus on Cloud Native technologies few years ago. He is now fully certified on Kubernetes (KCNA, CKA, CKAD and CKS). He embraces Open Source and dedicated to help the community. He is organizing the largest Kubernetes Meetup in Singapore. http://k8sug.com He created the automation scripts which can be found from GitHub to allow people to spin up a new Kubernetes Cluster in minutes. http://g.k8sug.com In addition, he created his YouTube channel to focus on Kubernetes Day 1 and Day 2 Data Management and Security. http://y.k8sug.com

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm super excited to be part of the Cloud Native Ambassadors program. I am pretty sure I will enjoy being able to work with other peers globally to learn and share.

name: Yosef Arbiv
bio:
I am married to Adi, father of three, and OpenTelemetry Group Leader at Cisco. My group and I are promoting OpenTelemetry adoption via contributions to the project, publishing blog posts on OpenTelemetry Blog (https://opentelemetry.io/blog/) & Cisco Tech Blog (https://techblog.cisco.com/tags/opentelemetry), and running OpenTelemetry talks & workshops at public events.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I want to promote OpenTelemetry and enable more people to use and contribute to it. I aim to improve the development processes in OpenTelemetry and to make the OpenTelemetry community more welcoming and supportive of new developers. I want to continue advocating for OpenTelemetry by promoting it at global events and helping others do so.

name: Yoshitaka Fujii
bio: I am working as a Platform Engineer. I am committed to building platforms that leverage Cloud Native technologies to provide a better development experience. In particular, I have a deep interest in tools such as Terraform, etcd, Grafana and Argo CD.

name: Yoshiyuki Tabata
bio:
Yoshiyuki Tabata is a Senior OSS Consultant at Hitachi, Ltd, responsible for API Security, especially Authentication/Authorization. As an authentication and authorization expert, he mainly consults on authentication and authorization infrastructure and API infrastructure, for example designing and building API/SSO systems in the financial, public, social, and industrial fields. He's also a contributor to API-related OSSs such as Keycloak and 3scale and develops features based on feedback from actual projects he consulted. He's also a conference speaker of API-related events and an author of some books and web articles about Identity and Access Management.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I usually consult with our customers on authentication and authorization infrastructure and API infrastructure (I have experience building systems for finance and government using Keycloak and Kubernetes), and it seems that the adoption rate of the CNCF family in general systems is still low in Japan. Also, in systems that adopt the CNCF family, there are many systems with weak security due to placing too much emphasis on developer experience and agility. Therefore, as a CNCF ambassador, I would like to use the knowledge I have cultivated through many projects (not only the knowledge as a security consultant but also the knowledge as a Keycloak contributor and a conference speaker) to disseminate solutions and know-how for a better and more secure CNCF ecosystem.

name: YoungHo Jung
bio: I am working as a Security Engineer:)

In my current role, I focus on maximizing customer value through the development and operation of B2C services. I am passionate about building Cloud Native Applications, with a particular fondness for AWS, Kubernetes and Terraform.

name: Yusuke TAKEI
bio: Yusuke is an experienced systems architect in different domains like FinTech, IoT and Biometrics. He is passionate about designing and implementing robust, scalable, highly available, maintainable and resilient systems upon Cloud Native technologies and Software Architecture principles. He has expertise in multi-cloud skills (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and Cloud Native technologies like Orchestrator (Kubernetes, Helm, KEDA), Service Proxy (NGINX, HAProxy), Security (OPA, Keycloak, Vault), Automation (Ansible, Terraform), Observability (Fluentbit, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana) as well as Java based application development with Object-Oriented-Design and Domain-Driven-Development.

name: Zakariae EL ALAOUI EL BELGHITI
bio: Passionate about development, I have started my journey as a PHP developper then tech lead .net to occupy now a position of Cloud Technical Architect. Continuous learning is my mojo and this is how I came to learn and explore Kubernetes. In my non virtual life, I enjoy runing and hiking.

bio: Hi I'm a DevOps engineer, working primarily with AWS, Kubernetes ,Jenkins ,EKS, .amongst other technologies. I have a passion for learning and exploring within the CNCF community

name: Zdeněk Váňa
bio:
My agenda is taking care of team serving cloud platform and design it's architecture. I'm a cloud enthusiast who missed events and community in my area. So I have relaunched Cloud Native Prague meetups and I co-organize Kubernetes Community Days Czech & Slovak.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm honored to be an ambassador as I can help with spreading knowledge about fantastic cloud native technologies and connecting people with the same interest. It can help them to solve their issues instead of reinventing the wheel over and over again.
company: Prusa Research a.s. / Freelance Cloud Consultant

name: Zekiye Aydemir
bio: I am a PostgreSQL&MongoDB and Kubernetes specialist with 7 years of experience managing large-scale, mission-critical systems. My expertise spans database optimization, cluster security, and cloud-native solutions. I’ve contributed to open-source initiatives like CloudNativePG and enjoy working on complex technical challenges in containerized environments. Passionate about continuous learning, I actively engage with the Kubernetes ecosystem and thrive in international teams, sharing knowledge and collaborating on innovative solutions.

name: Zeljko Zindovic
bio: I'm a tech geek who loves learning new tech, especially when it comes to cloud. I'm looking forward to contributing in that space someday.

name: Zhilong Wang
bio: An Architect specializing in cloud native areas such as Service Mesh, Serverless, and Cloud Platform, with expertise in microservices architecture and performance optimization. Currently, I am primarily involved in the development of open source projects listed at https://landscape.cncf.io/, including Kubernetes, Envoy, Mosn, and Layotto.

name: Zhiqiang Chen
bio: I am a user and advocate of cloud-native technologies since 2018. I provide support and solutions for cloud-native technologies. I enjoy studying technologies like Istio, supply chain security, Kubernetes, and Cilium, and I share my insights through blog articles. I wish to contribute to the cloud-native community and promote these technologies.

name: zou nengren
bio:
I have spent the last seven years honing my expertise in the cloud-native ecosystem, with a particular focus on maintaining various communities like Kubernetes, CoreDNS, KNative, and Containerd. While my experience in these areas has been invaluable, my current focus lies in the Cloud OS System. As a seasoned professional, I regularly share my knowledge and insights on cloud-native technologies through my blog, which can be found at ustack.io. Whether you are a novice or a seasoned pro, my blog posts offer practical tips and in-depth analysis that can help you stay ahead of the curve in this rapidly evolving field. So whether you are looking to dive deeper into Kubernetes or explore the latest trends in cloud-native ecosystem, be sure to check out my blog.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: being an CNCF ambassador provides me with the opportunity to share my knowledge and expertise in cloud-native technologies with a wider audience, and allows me to stay up-to-date with the latest developments and trends in cloud-native technologies

name: Łukasz Amróz
bio: Frontend Developer that have been working with Kubernetes for the past three years. Interested in DevOps tools and technologies.

name: 子篆 林
bio:
My current focus is cloud-native computing, programming languages, and system software. I'm working as a compiler developer at secondstate. My blog https://dannypsnl.me writes technical content about formal methods and mathematics. I'm an open source technology enthusiast, and very excited to push formal methods in cloud computing.

Why I am excited to be an ambassador: I'm passionate about helping people as I could, been an ambassador is a well way to do so. Besides that, this is a good opportunities do learn from others, like how to maintain communities, or their invaluable personal perspectives.

name: Nabarun Pal
bio: Nabarun is a Staff Software Engineer at VMware by Broadcom, a maintainer of the Kubernetes project, a Kubernetes SIG Contributor Experience chair and an emeritus member of the Kubernetes Steering Committee member. He is a Release Manager for Kubernetes and has been the Kubernetes 1.21 Release Team Lead. Nabarun has been an active member of 8 releases since 2019. He is an emeritus member of the Kubernetes Code of Conduct Committee. Nabarun continuously mentors newcomers in the community through various means. He has been featured multiple times in the Times of India and other publications for his work in the Kubernetes and Python communities. Nabarun has spoken at multiple KubeCon events in the past, as well as other CloudNative-focused conferences like Kubernetes Community Days.
